3.3.04Accommodation Door and Fittings


(1) General

The door to be insulated where fire insulation applied on the wall to which the door is fitted.


Steel hinged joiner door with steel frame shall be fitted to all living rooms, public rooms, toilets and lockers in living quarter.


Finishing for surface of doorframe shall be baked enamel and door to be coated PVC sheet unless otherwise specified.


The door catcher or door hook to be provided to all doors other than those with self-closing device.


Doors shall be fitted with lock, handle, sill plate and hinges but the wire mesh doors in the engine room could not have sill plate..


Rain shade shall be provided to the door facing to the weather without having overhanging deck above.


Sill height shall be in accordance with the relevant Rule and Regulation.


Step of checkered steel plate shall be provided to the entrance from the weather side on upper deck for sill of more than 400mm..


Clear size:

The height from the steel deck to the top of door opening shall be approx. 2,000 mm and each clear width shall be as follows:


900 mm:

Wheelhouse sliding door

800 mm:

Hospital, Dry provisions store from outside, Air-con. machinery room from outside.

700 mm:

Entrance to deckhouse corridors from outside, Public spaces, catering spaces, stairway, engine room from accommodation, living spaces, control spaces, etc.

600 mm:

Private toilet, pipe duct, cable duct, battery room, etc.


Door self-closing device to be applied as follows:


- Wheelhouse entrance from stairwar

- Stairway

- Elevator trunk door

- Entrance door from outside except steel single plate door

- Engine room entrance door from accommodation space

- Engine control room

- Entrance doors for purifier room

- Engine room escape trunk double door to steering gear room


All door handles to be of lever type.


Sound proof doos shall be provided for the entrance form ER to ECR and ER workshop.


Following doors to be provided with watch windows

a) Engine control room entrance door (400x450mm rectangle fixed glass)

b) Entrance to corridor from outside – “C” Class Door (250 mm diameter fixed glass).


(2)    Weathertight Hinged Door


Material        Steel plate

Construction    Single plate with stiffener, steel clips and dogs

Application    Entrance to forecastle, corridor on upper deck to captain deck, and sundry space faced to weather side


(3)    “A” Class Door


Material        Steel sheet

Construction    Pontoon (with insulation)

Application    Stair case, wheelhouse and other space according to Rule requirement


(4)    “B” Class Door


Material        Steel sheet

Construction    Pontoon (with insulation)

Application    Cabin and other space according to Rule requirement


(5)    “C” Class Door


Material     Steel sheet

Construction     Pontoon

Application    Cabin door led to bedroom and private toilet

Hospital bathroom according to Rule requirement

Entrance to corridor on upper deck and boat deck with 250 mm diameter fixed glass watching window


(6)    Weather Proof Sliding Door


Material     Fibre reinforced plastic (FRPSUS304)

Construction    Pontoon with square fixed glass

Application    Wheelhouse side (port and starboard)

3.3.05Window and Side Scuttle


(1)    General


Steel window boxes to be provided for all windows and side scuttles except in the wheelhouse.


Spray fresh water pipe connected to domestic fresh water line to be led over the wheelhouse front window for washing.


Bridge deck shall be extended forward about 700 mm with handrail as the monkey stage in way of front windows of wheelhouse to facilitate cleaning of the windows as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


The glass for windows and side scuttles shall be of toughened safety glass.

All rectangular windows of steel frame shall be provided for boat deck and above and engine control room.


Steel frame shall be provided for wheelhouse windows.


Three (3) straight-line blade window wipers shall be provided for the front windows.


Sunscreens of roller blind type to be provided for all the wheelhouse front windows.


Three (3) electric heated glasses to be provided for wheelhouse front window (center, port and starboard).

3. Window sizes are approx. only.

3.3.06Side Scuttle


All side scuttles to be of steel frame (350 mm diameter) and to be provided on the upper deck.


The side scuttle on the upper deck level to be fitted with top hinged deadlight of steel.

3.4    DECK COVERING

3.4.01General

All weather deck surfaces shall have no deck covering.

The deck covering for the accommodation on the upper deck level, basically no leveling work to be made for providing horizontal plane to the cambered deck part, except for office or public space which require horizontal plane floor.

Leveling work for deck covering shall be provided for living space, public spaces and refrigeration chamber.

PVC skirting to be provided to boundary wall except sanitary and catering spaces.

3.4.02Deck Covering

The deck covering to be provided as follows:

Material

Application

2 mm thick vinyl sheet (high, heavy quality) on about 12 mm thick deck composition of latex type

Captain class day room and bed room

Senior officer’s day room and bed room

2 mm thick vinyl sheet on about 12 mm thick deck composition of latex type

Other living space

Passage space

Public space

Ditto

Gymnasium

Non-skid type rubber matting

Emergency generator room

(Around switch board)

Perforated Rubber mat

Bridge wing

2 mm thick non-skid vinyl sheet on about 50mm thick fireproof deck covering

Wheelhouse & chart space

Engine control room

(Around switch board)

Paint only

Space Except as specified above

3.4.03Floor covering in Wet Space


Non-slip tile with adhesive:    Private toilet and bathroom (unit type)

Cement and non-slip tile    :        Galley,pantry,laundry,public toilet and changing room

The cement bed or equivalent to be laid under tiles so that the total thickness of cement and tile to be average 40 mm and necessary slope to scupper to be provided.


Stainless steel gutterway and cover (perforated) to be provided for galley.


Other spaces not specified above to have paint finish only

3.5    STAIRWAY, STORM RAIL, ELEVATOR, ETC.

3.5.01Interior Stairway, Passage and Storm Rail


(1) General


The steel interior stairway shall be fitted as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


Clear breadth

About 800 mm

Inclination

45 - 50 degree to horizontal

Side frame

Steel, painted

Tread without riser

Steel, covered with 2 mm thick vinyl sheet

Step guard (non slip)

Aluminum alloy

Hand rail

Stainless steel pipe of 50A

Hand rail stanchion

Stainless steel pipe of 32A



Plastic plate to be provided at each deck in stairway casing for indication of title of deck .


(2) Passage


Passabe in accommodation to be about 1,200 mm in width from wall to wall.


(3) Storm Rail


The storm rail made of stainless steel pipe shall be fitted at about 1000 mm high above the deck in passage of living quarters and front of wheelhouse according to the Builder’s practice.



3.5.02 Elevator


(1) General


The construction and material for elevator shall be as per maker’s standard.


The elevator machine room shall be arranged in Upper deck.


Cage speed shall be about 0.75 m/second.


Total eight (8) stops shall be arranged with two (2) stops of 2nd deck and 3rd deck in engine room and the other stops in Upper deck, Boat deck , “A” deck, “B” deck , “C” deck and Captain deck.


In side wall of cage shall be of stainless steel of hair line finished with a lifting capacity of 350 kg for 4 persons.


The size of the cage shall be in accordance with maker’s standard.

Cage shall be operated by a single automatic control system (single selective system).


(2) Accessories


Cage door of min. 700 mm clear size shall be mechanically operated automatic sliding type with safety interlock and landing doors shall be of manually operated hinge type with safety interlock at each floor.


Safety device such as manual handling device, over load relay, escape hatch, etc. shall be provided.


Alarm buzzer and lamp in conjunction with a push button in the cage shall be provided in wheelhouse.

3.6    FURNITURE & FITTINGS OF LIVING, PUBLIC, NAVIGATION & CONTROL SPACE

3.6.01General


The furniture and fittings shall be of strong construction for shipboard use and in harmony with decorative treatment of the space and to be in accordance with the Builder’s practice.


Main furniture and fittings shall be as described in detail and the size and number of furniture may be changed slightly by the cabin arrangement.


In general, the furniture to be constructed of the plywood/chipboard and covered with melamine film finish in visible part only. Where the solid wood for leg or frame is adopted, the pine or lauan to be applied.


Top of the reception table, mess table and desk to be finished with the melamine plastic laminate.


The sizes of wooden furniture are only approximate and depend on design and space available irrespective of the description in the Specification.


The steel furniture to be of commercial stock with durable construction.


The size of steel furniture may be changed a little to meet those of commercial stock, irrespective of the description in the Specification.


The shape of furniture to be of standard type and the fixing arrangement of furniture to the wall, deck and/or ceiling to be in accordance with the Builder’s practice.


The leg of table to be fitted to suit the function as per Builder’s practice.


Closing board may be provided for clearance between fixed wooden furniture and sidewall where necessary.


The color scheme book to be submitted to the Buyer for approval.


Upholstery for sofas and chairs shall be as follows and the stuffing material shall be of polyurethane sponge.


    

Type of material

Location

Woven fabric

Captain & senior officer cabins

Officer’ recreation room

Officer’s mess room

Vinyl leather

Other cabins

Other public spaces

Control spaces



3.6.02Hardware


(1) General


The hardware to be of aluminum or chromium coated brass, nickel plate steel and stainless steel in general.


(2)    Lock to be fitted according to the following:


Lock type

Location

Cylinder mortise lock

Living spaces

Public spaces

Control spaces

Private lavatory

Catering spaces

Sundry spaces

Mortise latch without thumb turn

Stairway

Indicate mortise lock

Public lavatory

Pad lock

Bond store external steel doors


(3)    Keys shall be provided as follows:


Three sets of keys to be supplied for each lock set.


Keys shall be divided into user’s group in accordance with shipboard practice.


Three (3) sets of master keys shall be provided for each group.


All keys in 3 sets to be provided.


All keys shall be supplied with a plastic identification tag and a list of keys identifying the cabin and number shall be supplied by the Builder.

The tag shall be marked in English only.


(4)    Other hardware

Hat and coat hook to be fitted where necessary.


Chain type-fastening device to be provided for loose chairs. Elastic type rope fastening device may be used for loose chairs in living room.

3.7    FURNISHINGS AND FITTINGS OF SANITARY SPACES

3.7.01General


Private toilet and bathroom to be of unit type.


Furnishings and fittings to be provided according to the table below.


All exposed metal fixtures, taps, valves, accessories and trim to be of aluminum or chromium coated brass or stainless steel.


Rubber washers to be fitted between all china plumbing fixtures and metal supports.


One lamp and shaver socket shall be provided for toilet cabinet or mirror for illumination of the toilet space.

3.12    REFRIGERATED PROVISIONS CHAMBER

3.12.01General


The refrigerating chamber to be divided into the following compartment:


Compartment

Approx. Volume (m3)

Temperature maintained.

Meat room

20

-18oC

Fish room

13

-18oC

Vegetable room

32

+4oC

Lobby

10

un-cooled

Total

75


Each chamber except the lobby shall be cooled by its own unit cooler.

    

The lobby shall be cooled by air infiltration from other chambers and temperature shall not be regulated.


A refrigerating plant to be designed to maintain the above temperature at cooling water temperature of 36oC and at the outside temperature of 35oC.


The dial thermometers for each cold chamber should be fitted in lobby near the each cold chamber’s door.

A remote temperature indication for each chamber to be displayed on LCD of engine control console.

A remote temperature indication for each chamber should be led to galley.


One refrigerating unit to have capacity enough to maintain the specified temperature within 18 hours running per day after cooling down while the other unit to serve as stand-by.


3.12.02Refrigerating System


The cooling system to be of R407C direct expansion and air circulating system with automatic control device and to be able to keep the temperature of the refrigerating chamber. (see Electric Part).


Valve panel to be located in the adjacent part of each cooler as per the maker’s standard.


Electric heating coil shall be provided for the unit cooler, drip pan and drain pipe in meat and fish rooms, and the heating coil shall be operated by timer switch.


The material and design to be as per the maker’s standard unless otherwise specified.


Cooling down test for refrigerated provision chamber to be carried out after the completion in accordance with Builder’s practice.


3.12.03Refrigerating Equipment


(1) Unit air cooler


No.    One (1) in each compartment

Type    Wall or ceiling suspension type consisting of a copper cooling coil with aluminum fins and one (1) electric motor actuated propeller fan, drip pan and casing.


(2) Compressor


No.    Two (2)

Type        Multi-cylinder single acting type driven by an electric motor via vee belt or directly.


(4)    Condenser


No.    Two (2)

Type    Horizontal straight shell and tube type


(5)    Miscellaneous


The following shall be provided:


One (1) gas dryer

Automatic temperature control device

One (1) ozone generator in vegetable room


3.12.04Piping System


Cooling water shall be supplied by the low temperature fresh water from the low temperature fresh water pump in the engine room.


Scupper in each chamber to be of water seal type .


Drain pipe with electric heater led from drip pan of each unit cooler for meat room and fish room shall be connected to the scupper pipe below deck.


Fresh water faucet with wash basin to be provided outside the lobby.


3.12.05Insulation


(1)    Ceiling, lining and floor


Location

Insulation and Construction

Overhead and side wall

0.6 mm galvanized steel sheet + 120 mm foamed polyurethane + 0.6 mm stainless steel sheet T=120mm

Divisional wall between compartments of same temperature

0.6 mm galvanizedstainless steel sheet + 100 mm foamed polyurethane + 0.6 mm stainless steel sheet T=100mm

Divisional wall between compartments of different temperature

0.6 mm galvanizedstainless steel sheet + 100 mm foamed polyurethane + 0.6 mm stainless steel sheet T=100mm

Floor

0.6 mm galvanized steel sheet +120 mm foamed polyurethane + 18 mm waterproof plywood + 0.6 mm thick embossed stainless steel plate T=150mm



(2)    Doors


Type        Air tight hinged pontoon

Material        Stainless steel filled with foamed polyurethane

Clear breadth    700 mm

Clear height    about 1650 mm

Accessory    Rubber packing

1 - Door fastener with handle that can be unlocked from inside of the chamber by pushing a push rod

1 - Hand grip inside of the chamber

    1 - Hook and eye for keeping door at open position

Door frame    Stainless steel filled with foamed polyurethane


Lobby door to be in breadth and of steel pontoon type with lock and handle.


Electric heating cable to be provided for door frame of meat and fish room.


3.12.06 Miscellaneous


Stainless steel meat rail and stainless steel hook to be fitted in the meat room.


Stainless steel shelf to be provided in each chamber except lobby.


The grating of soft wood to be fitted on the floor under shelf.


One (1) set of sealed locker to be provided in vegetable room.

3.13    VENTILATION AND AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM

3.13.01General


The living quarters to be ventilated and air-conditioned as follows:


(1)    The following spaces to be air-conditioned


Living space

Public space

Navigation and Control space


(2)    Wheelhouse & chart space, Changing room，crew's laundry, officer's laundry, Galley, Pantry, Fire control room and dry provisions store to be conditioned by spot cooling and heating without consideration of the heat gain or loss from the space.

    

(3)     The galley to be cooled and heated by a separate packaged air conditioner.


Air in air-conditioned space, except hospital, to be exhausted into the passage through the door louver and led to air handling unit for re-circulation and exhaust to weather part through door gap of private sanitary space, if applicable.


Air from hospital not to be re-circulated.


The engine control room to be air conditioned by the package type unit cooler.


3.13.02Ventilation and Air Change Rate


The air conditioning and mechanical ventilation system shall be designed to have the following minimum rate of air change (times/hour) based on the volume of each compartment.


Compartment

Air conditioning

Mechanical



Supply

Exhaust

Living space

8

-

-

Public space

8

-

-

Wheelhouse & chart space

10

-

-

Private toilet

-

-

15

Hospital

12

15

Hospital toilet

15

Changing room

-

-

15

Public toilet, crew’s laundry, officers’ laundry

-

-

15

Galley

10

15

40

Pantry

10

15

Dry provisions store

10

-

8





Fire control room

10

Cleaning gear locker & linen locker, bonded store

-

-

5


Natural ventilation to be provided in other enclosed spaces where not specified in the table as far as possible.


3.13.03Air Conditioning System


(1) General


The air conditioning system to be of high pressure and single duct system with central heating and cooling unit.


The plant to be designed to cool or heat the supply air and to maintain the following condition when the doors, windows and side scuttles are closed.


The capacity of the air conditioning plant to be decided on the condition that min. 40% of fan intake air to be taken from outside. This ratio may be changed if so required to meet the fresh air rate requirement of the regulatory body of ship's registry.


The plant to be dimensioned to meet following condition:


            Dry bulb temp.    Relative humidity

In summer:    

Outside air    35oC        70 %

Inside air    27oC        50 %


In winter:

Outside air    -15o C

Inside air     20o C        50 %


Seawater temperature    32o C

LT. F.W.Temp        36o C

Refrigerant        R407C


(2)    Test and Trial


The central unit to be tested at the maker’s shop in accordance with the maker’s usual practice.


After the completion of air conditioning system, following tests to be performed in accordance with Builder’s practice.


1. Air volume test

2. Cooling or heating test


The air conditioning test to be carried out as applicable in connection with testing season. When the heating or cooling is not applicable, only the running tests to be performed.


(3)Air Conditioning System


The air conditioning plant to consist of two (2) 50% capacity central air handling units and two (2) sets of 50% capacity R407C condensing unit installed in the air conditioning unit room. The material and design to be as per the maker’s standard unless otherwise specified.


Seat and securing strap for two R407C gas bottles to be provided in air-condition unit room adjacent to the refrigerating condensing unit.


(4)    Air Handling Units


Each unit to consist of the following:


One (1) - Fresh air re-circulation air mixing section with two (2) dampers (manual)

One (1) - Removable air filter

One (1) - Steam heating coil

One (1) - R407C direct expansion coil

One(1) - Steam humidifier

One (1) - Ventilating fan of single speed electric motor driven centrifugal type


The steam for heater shall be supplied from the engine room steam system (Refer to Machinery part).Humidifier to be feed by fresh water.


(5)    Refrigerating-Condensing-Unit


One (1) - R407C compressor driven by an electric motor directly or via vee belt

One (1) - Condenser of horizontal straight shell and tube type

One (1) - Gas dryer



(6)    Piping System


Cooling water to be supplied by low temperature fresh water from the low temperature fresh water pump in the engine room.


(7)    Ducting System


Fresh air for the central unit to be drawn through the air supply head and to be led to the central unit.

Re-circulation air for the central unit to be drawn through the grille provided on the wall or ceiling of the corridor space and to be led to the central unit.


Air conditioning supply ducts to be pre-insulated spiral duct made of galvanized steel sheet.


Controllable diffuser to be fitted at outlet of the air conditioning supply duct in air-conditioned space and punkah louver in other space.


Trunk and duct exposed to weather deck to be min.4 mm thickness and to be weathertight.


Air intake to be arranged on upper-deck with removeable and washable fitted.


Separate mechanical exhaust fan shall be provided for the hospital toilet. Air in the hospital shall not be re-circulated.


(8)    Temperature Control System


In summer:


(a)    The refrigerant gas for air-cooling to be controlled to maintain a reasonable constant temperature of discharge side by means of unloading mechanism of the refrigerating compressor.

(b)    When the ambient temperature becomes lower than condition (a) the compressor to be stopped automatically and restarted automatically when the temperature is higher than condition (a), by the electro-magnetic valve and thermostat, having thermo bulb located in return air duct.


In winter:


Regulating steam valve on the steam air-heating coil to be controlled by the thermo bulb located in the duct of fresh air inlet and heater outlet.


Automatic humidity control to be provided.


In intermediate season:

Air to be supplied without cooling or heating from air conditioning plant.


(9) Galley shall be air conditioned by package type unit cooler with electric heater.


3.13.04Mechanical Ventilation in Accommodation Area


(1)    Fan


The electric motor driven centrifugal or axial ventilation fan to be provided as follows:


System

No. of fan

Galley exhaust system

1

Galley supply system (to be combined with the separate package air conditiner supply unit)

1

Sanitary and sundry space exhaust system

1

Hospital exhaust system

1

        

Air conditioning unit room exhaust fan

1

Elevator machine room and lift trunk exhaust fan

1

Changing room & laundry exhaust fan

1

Pantry exhaust fan

1

Laundry exhaust fanMess room and sundry space etc. exhaust fan

1



(2)    Vent Duct System


Mechanical ventilation space which is not specified above to be incorporated into the system which is preferable on duct arrangement.


Mechanical ventilation duct to be single spiral or rectangular duct made of galvanized steel sheet having same thickness as the air conditioning supply duct, but not to be insulated.


Supply and suction side of the mechanical ventilation duct to have duct opening with screen of stainless steel.


Ventilating hood of stainless steel with washable stainless steel grease filter to be provided over the cooking range in galley.


Outlet terminal of exhaust fan from the sanitary space and galley to be arranged away from air intake as far as practicable.


(3)    Natural Ventilation


Spaces, which are not air-conditioned or mechanically ventilated, to be provided with natural ventilators such as mushroom ventilator, wall ventilator or door louver, where necessary.


Ventilating louver with shutter may be provided on the door leading to the passage from the living space (except hospital) and public space.


Coaming height of ventilator to be as rule requirement for the forecastle deck, upper deck, A deck and to be as the Builder’s practice for the other decks.


Stainless steel screen to be provided at weather opening of the supply and exhaust ventilation ductas the Builder’s practice.


All filter meshes, frames ,bolts and nuts for ventilation on weather deck to be made of stainless steel.

4    OUTFITTING PART

4.1    CARGO HATCH COVER

4.1.01General


The cargo hatch covers of welded steel construction shall be provided as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


The hatch covers and hatch coamings shall be designed, constructed and equipped in accordance with the maker’s standard and the requirement of CSR.


4.1.02Hatch size, hatch cover type and construction


The opening of each hatch shall be as follows:


                Length        Width


No.1 Hatchway        15.48m        16.50m

No.2 Hatchway        15.48m        20.00m

No.3 Hatchway        15.48m        20.00m

No.4 Hatchway        15.48m        20.00m

No.5 Hatchway        15.48m        20.00m

No.6 Hatchway        15.48m        20.00m    

No.7 Hatchway        15.48m        20.00m    

No.8 Hatchway        15.48m        20.00m    

No.9 Hatchway        17.20m        16.50m    


The hatch covers shall be of weathertight and shall be of 2-panels side rolling type operated by rack and pinion with electro-hydraulic oil motors.


The cargo hatch covers shall be built-up as single skin construction with peaked top as per maker’s standard.


The hatch covers shall be fabricated mainly with high tensile steel, and mild steel may be used partly in accordance with the maker’s practice.


The hatch cover shall be designed for loads as required by the Class Rules, and no cargo loading on hatch covers shall be considered.


The hatch cover for No.6 ballast hold shall be considered for water movement in fully filled condition.


Additional strengthening for partially filled holds shall not be considered.


No.3 hatch cover should be designed and constructed suitable for helicopter landing with maximum helicopter take off weight of no less than 4,000KG.



4.1.03Hatch cover operation


The hatch covers shall be designed and operated under the ship’s condition up to 3 degrees in heel and 2 degrees in trim but no test shall be carried out with such condition onboard during trial.


Partial opening or one panel opening of the hatch covers shall not be considered.


Each panel of each hatch cover shall be operated independently by means of a hydraulic motor with rack and pinion along each end hatch coaming and trackway.


One (1) hydraulic motor shall be provided for each panel and installed in the middle of one (1) side hatch coaming.


One pair of panels of a cover in closed position shall be lifted simultaneously by fixed hydraulic jacks located under the running wheels roll up roll system (or equivalent).


One (1) local control stand for each hatch shall be arranged at the end of each hatchway on upper deck.


One set of portable auxiliary electric pump unit and necessary fittings for cover operation to be provided for emergency operation.


4.1.04Fittings and others


The weather tightness of the hatch covers shall be achieved by means of one (1) row of compression bar against the packing fitted into the steel-retaining channel.


Steps shall be provided at end of hatch for inspection of hold condition.


The material of the packing shall be flexseal rubber covered with neoprene.The compression bars shall be of stainless steel plate, which shall be welded on the top plate of the hatch coaming.The compression bars shall be of stainless steel round bar welded on steel plate, which shall be intsalled on the meeting joints of the two (2) panels of each hatch cover. Support pads are of standard steel against steel type.


The hatch cover shall be secured to the top plate of the hatch coaming by mechanical auto cleating (roll up roll or equivalent), and the meeting joints of the panels of each hatch cover shall be self-engaged.


Stoppers and locking devices shall be provided for the hatch covers fore and aft trackway in normal and extra open positions and the panels shall not protrude out of the ship’s sideline in normal stowed (open) position.


No grain feeding hatches shall be provided on the hatch covers.


For access to top of hatch cover, one (1) vertical ladder with platform (where necessary) shall be provide for fore and aft ends in case for closed condition and one (1) vertical ladder shall be provided for the access on each hatch cover panel when opened for fore and aft ends. (six (6) for each hatch)


Sockets and portable stanchions with vinyl covered galvanized steel wire rope (12.5 mm dia.) shall be provided for the meeting part of each cargo hold cover.


One (1) ullage hole shall be provided to No. 6 hatch cover.


Two (2) sets of gas sampling plug with cover shall be arranged for each hatch covers, one on port side and one on starboard side for gas detection in accordance with the Rules and Regulations. Multi-gas analyzer instruments to be supplied by the Buyer for this purpose.


Two (2) water drain channels shall be provided at hatch cover center joint point.


All moving parts shall be lubricated by means of standard grease nipple of ample size in general. All grease points shall be accessible.


The detail for cargo ventilation system to see section 4.12.02.


4.1.05Hydraulic power pack and piping


One (1) set of hydraulic power pack unit consisting of two (2) electric motors, two (2) oil pumps (2 x 50% rating) and other necessary accessories to serve for opening and shutting the hatch cover shall be provided in midship storeroom.


The system to have a capacity to operate one pair of panel (either from open to close, or vice versa) within approximately 2 minutes (excluding jack up/down time) with both pumps running.


4.1.06HelicopterLanding Mark


The following shall be provided on No.3 Hatch cover for the landing helicopter. Landing Mark to be painted on the hatch cover. All related appliance relating to the mark not to be provided except portable hand rail and two (2) 6kg Dry powderfoam portable fire extinguishers.

4.1.07Others


The closed hatch covers shall be hose tested as per Class requirement.


Spare parts and special tools shall be furnished in accordance with maker’s standard.

4.2    MANHOLES AND ACCESS HATCHES

4.2.01Manhole


The manhole to be of 600 mm x 400 mm in size with bolted steel plate cover unless otherwise specified shall be provided for peak tanks, fresh water tanks, chain locker, pipe duct, voids, cofferdam, oil tanks and other tanks and compartments in accordance with Builder’s standard.


All ballast tanks shall be accessible with cargo holds filled, either from main deck, through connection trunks from upper wing tanks or from the duct keel.


The manhole to be watertight, oiltight or gastight depending upon its location and purpose.


The manholes with covers to be located as near to the transverse partition as possible.


Ladder or step to be fitted in way of the manhole for access to the compartment inside where necessary.


The manhole cover to be provided with two (2) hand grips and marked with the name of compartment by welding bead.


Two (2) manholes shall be provided to each tank and cofferdam of which the diagonal distance exceeds 9 m, except pipe duct, on plane surface, and one (1) manhole shall be provided for small tanks and other compartments.


The manhole covers shall be secured by galvanized mild steel bolts and nuts for indoor. Stainless steel bolts and galvanized nuts shall be used for manhole located at double bottom in cargo hold and engine room. Stainless steel bolts and brass nuts shall be used for manholes located on exposed weather deck.


One (1) weathertight liner type manhole (600 mm dia.) shall be provided for each cargo hold aft part for the hoisting sludge.


The location and number of manholes to be as per the following table:


Compartment

4.2.02Access Hatch for Cargo Hold


Each cargo hold to have two (2) sets of weathertight hinged type access hatch having clear opening of about 800 mm x 600 mm square, as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


The cover of each hatch to be suitably stiffened and to be fitted with packing holder, neoprene gasket and securing devices to be operable from both sides for the cover in accordance with the requirement of International Load Line Convention 1966.


The material of bolts and hinge pins to be stainless steel.


Safety device to keep it in open position to be provided.


Coaming height of the hatch to be of about 610 mm.


4.2.03Access Hatch for Pipe Duct


Access from upper deck to pipe duct to be made by vertical access trunk on transverse corrugated bulkhead in cargo hold at pipe duct fore end, mid-part and No.8 cargo hold aft.


Each access trunk shall have one (1) set of vertical access/escape hatch having clear opening of about 800 mm x 600 mm square with coaming height of 610 mm. Access from engine room to pipe duct shall be by watertight manhole in engine room.


The access hatch covers to be operable from both sides.


The material of hinge pin shall be of stainless steel.


Grease point to be provided as necessary.


The trunk to be used as an air route for pipe duct ventilation as well.


A warning notice should be posted at the watertight manhole in the engine room to the effect that the watertight manhole in engine room for access from the engine room to the pipe duct must be closed except when in use.



4.2.04Other Hatch


The following hatch of hinged or bolted type to be provided. The hinged type hatch of 1.2 m x 1.2 m size and above to be fitted with the counter balance weight for easy handling.


The material of bolts and hinge pins to be of stainless steel.


The packing to be of neoprene rubber.

Note:

The hatch for rope storage space to be provided with round bar at top and bottom rim of coaming so as to protect rope from wearing. Inside of the rope hatch cover to be provided with a rope holder.


Top of hatch coaming to be ground smoothly.


The portable stanchion in four corners with rope to be provided around the engine room hatch.


Each access hatch shall be marked with the name of the compartment by welding bead with paint abbreviation of the compartment names.


Rope hatch cover at steering gear room shall be provided with necessary socket for installing portable davit.


The hatch on upper deck shall have caution mark state: ”TO BE KEPT CLOSED AT SEA”.

4.3    STEEL DOORS

The weathertight steel doors to be fitted at the following entrances as per Class Rules.


Entrance to accommodation space from upper and A deck and above.

Entrances to the enclosed spaces from upper deck.


The clear height of door opening from deck covering, sill height, number of clips, etc. to be in accordance with the requirement of International Load Line Convention, the National Authority and Builder’s standard practice.


All door openings to be rectangular with round corners.

The steel door to be rectangular with round corners.


All steel doors to have heavy hinges, which are strong enough to withstand the weight of the door (according to GB). The hinge pin to be of stainless steel and to be equipped with a grease nipple for lubrication.


The clip handle to stand at right angle to the frame when the door is closed while the clip handle to stand parallel to the frame when the door is opened.


Eyebrow shall be fitted to exposed steel doors.


Adequate stopper to be fitted for all hinged doors.


“O” & “S” mark to be provided for dog cleat (clip) direction.


The clear height to top of door opening from deck covering to be not less than 1,900 mm, and width to be 700 mm in general.


The padlock to be provided where necessary.


As for doors in living quarter, refer to Accommodation Section.


The hose test for hatch as required by the Regulation concerned and the chalk test for the weathertight steel door to be carried out.

4.4    LADDER, PLATFORM, STEPS, ETC.

1.%2.%3 General


The ladder and stair shall be arranged in accordance with the General Arrangement Plan and where required in tank, on deck, on mast, etc.


All ladder and stair to be of steel. The spacing of treads and rung to be as uniform as practicable through the whole ladder and stair.


The step of inclined ladder to be fillet-welded to the stringer, while the step of vertical ladder to be penetrated both sides of the stringer and welded.


The step, rung and handrail for ladders fitted on deck to be galvanized.

If the total height of vertical ladder exceeds 9,000 mm, the intermediate platform to be provided.


If it is impractical to have either inclined or vertical ladder, the step of square bar to be directly fitted on the surface.


The walkway, rampway, etc. to be provided, where necessary, according to the Builder’s practice.

2.%2.%3 Access Ladder for Cargo Hold


One (1) steel spiral ladder for each cargo hold shall be provided with vertical ladders at upper and lower parts as per the requirement of AMSA.


The spiral ladder to be protected in accordance with Builder’s practice without trunk.


In addition to the spiral ladder a vertical ladder shall be provided in each cargo hold on the opposite side.


The vertical ladders in way of bulkhead lower stool shall be of strong construction as per Builder’s practice against grab damage.


Handrail ending to be closed in adequate way according to the Builder’s practice.

The material, size, etc. of ladder to be in accordance with the table in section 4.4.06

4.4.03Access Ladder for Other Tanks


One (1) set of vertical ladder or steps to be provided access to tank from each manhole.


One (1) set of vertical ladder to be provided for access trunk between topside and double bottom water ballast tanks. Sufficient steps and handles to be provided at bottom opening of topside water tank in access to the trunk.

4.4.04Outside Ladder


Adequate number of inclined ladders to be provided for outside of accommodation decks as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


Non-skid paint shall be provided at foot of each inclined ladder in accommodation area.


The ladder shall be bolted to an eyeplate, which welded to deck and shall be galvanized and painted.


Non-skid paint shall be provided at foot and top of each inclined ladder in accordance with Builder’s practice.

4.4.05Other Access Ladder, Steps & Crossovers


Vertical ladder or steps of 300 mm or 350 mm width to be provided where necessary for access to mast, post, etc.


No ladder or step to be provided for the hatch listed in section 4.2.04 .


The step type crossover of open grating construction shall be provided on upper deck where necessary for crew access.


Slant type crossover shall be fitted over piping near to pilot ladder position, for trolley with inclination of not more than 14o to the horizontal.


Open grating for crossover shall be galvanized and painted and checkered plate shall be painted only.


The construction, sizes etc. of the crossover way shall be in accordance with the Builder’s standard.


One (1) crossover each to be provided between “A” deck and engine casing top on P & S side.

No vertical ladder shall be provided for hatches in 4.2.04.

4.5RAIL AND STANCHION

4.5.01Handrail


In general, the open rail and stanchion to be fitted around all exposed decks and house tops as shown on the General Arrangement Plan, except where the bulwark or screen is provided and where protection is available by equipment, such as lifeboat, etc.


The handrail and stanchion with stay of shipside, deckhouse and engine casing on exposed deck only to be galvanized. Other handrail and stanchion to be painted.


The material and size of top and mid rail, stanchion and stay to be as follows:


Location

Top rail

Mid rail

Stanchion

Upper deck/deck house/engine casing on exposed deck

(steel R.B.)

65mm x 16mm flat bar

65 mm x 9mm flat bar


Number of mid rail to be in accordance with ICLL 1966.


The height of top rail to be min. 1,050 mm above the deck.


The stanchion on superstructure deck to be welded to the curtain plate or deck and to be well stayed to ensure rigidity of rail.


A gate to be arranged port and starboard in way of accommodation ladder, pilot ladder, provision handling portion, lifeboat embarkation station, etc.


End of handrail to be closed in accordance with the Builder’s practice.


The stanchion to be provided, in general, at about 1500 mm interval and the stay at every third stanchion.


4.5.02Storm Rail


Galvanized storm rail of 42 mm outside diameter steel pipe to be fitted on outside wall of deckhouse where the crew usually walk around and positioned at about 1000 mm above the deck with adequate distance from the wall.


The storm rail on exposed area to be galvanized and painted, while those in enclosed area to be painted only.



4.5.03Life Line & Walkway


Removable type lifeline to be provided according to the Rules and Regulations from the front wall of deckhouse to the upper deck forward at the side of a one (1) meter walkway in accordance with Builder’s practice.


Fitting for life line shall be provided on both sides of the vessel.


The lifeline to be of galvanized steel wire of 10 mm dia. covered with vinyl tube.


Non-skid paint to be applied along the walkway.

4.6    POST AND MAST

4.6.01General


The mast and post with necessary block and fitting to be installed as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


Platform, railing, vertical ladder or step to be arranged in way of lights, radar, horn and other equipment and to be painted.


The height of the mast and post to be determined in accordance with the Regulation concerned.


Vertical ladders to be provided with safety hoop at the interval of 1.5 m for the ladder whose height exceed 5.0 m. the safety hoop at the entrance of the ladder to be fitted at 2.5 m level above deck.


The construction, material etc. of the masts, posts and davits to be in accordance with the Builder’s standards.


4.6.02Fore Mast


One (1) fore mast of “D” shaped section with steel plate construction to be fitted on Forecastle deck. However eye plates to be fitted on the mast and on deck for later installation of rigging wire stays if found necessary.


Navigation lights, floodlights and One (1) electric motor piston horn to be fitted on the mast.


4.6.03Radar/Signal Mast


One (1)“D” shaped combined radar and signal mast of welded steel construction with the steel wire stays to be provided on the top of wheelhosue.


However, fixed eye plates to be fitted on mast and deck for later installation of steel wire stays if found necessary.


The mast to be fitted with the navigation light, flag yard, signal yard, antenna fittings, step, air horn etc.


4.6.04Floodlight Post


One (1) floodlight post of steel pipe construction collapsible by manual operation to be arranged at midship area as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


4.6.05Rigging & Flag Post


(1)    Ropes


    Standing rigging to be of galvanized steel wire rope with wire thimble and set up with turnbuckle.


    Accommodation ladder handling rope etc. to be of galvanized steel wire rope.


    All necessary steel wire and synthetic fiber rope for miscellaneous davits etc. to be provided and installed.


(2)    Blocks


    All necessary blocks for miscellaneous davits etc. to be provided.


(3)    Flag staff


Flag staff ofpainted to have block and cleat for rope.

One jack staff to be fitted on Forecastle Deck forward.

One ensign staff to be fitted on upper deck aft.

4.7    SHIP SERVICE HANDLING GEAR

4.7.01Provision and Store Handling and Suez Mooring Boat Crane


Two (2) sets of electro-hydraulic cylinder luffing crane to be provided on deckhouse aft, for handling provision andSuez Mooring Boat and machinery parts in the engine room.


The crane to be designed for the vessel’s condition up to heeling by 3 deg. and trim by 2 deg. as maximum.


Sufficient length of galvanized steel wire rope to be provided on the winch drum so that the hook can be lowered to the waterline when the vessel is in dry dock for adequate operation.


The crane to be located at aft end of deckhouse so as to effectively serve engine room hatch. Suitable arrangement to be provided for securing the jib safely when the crane is not in use.


Principal particular

Lifting capacity

                    8.0 metric ton S.W.L for port side and

    4.0 metric ton S.W.L. for starboard side


Hoisting speed            10 m/min, approximately

Luffing time            Maker’s standard

Slewing speed            Maker’s standard

Max. Outreach    Approximately 4.2 m beyond vessel’s side. (half breadth)


Construction, material etc. except otherwise specified in this specification to be in accordance with the maker’s standard and Builder’s practice.

4.7.02F.O. Hose Handling Davit


One (1) set of davit of 0.95tons S.W.L. capacity with electric driven winch to be provided at bunker station on each side of vessel for the handling of fuel oil hose.


4.7.03Suez Canal Searchlight Davit


One (1) set of Suez Canal searchlight davit of 0.5 ton S.W.L. capacity to be provided on the Forecastle deck forward and to be operated by the manual chain block supplied to the vessel.


The stowage seat for a Suez searchlight to be provided in the bosun’s store.


4.7.04Sludge Handling Davit


One (1) portable davit operated by an air motor with a capacity of 0.2 ton (SWL) to be supplied for handling the sludge and residual cargo from cargo holds. The davit to be also used for handling the pilot rope ladder and socket to be provided near the pilot landing station.


4.7.05Pipe Duct Trolley


One (1)    manually traveling trolley with rails to be provided in pipe duct.


The trolley to be fitted with manual brake and securing fittings.


4.7.06Portable ladder Handling Davit


A portable davit of 0.1 ton (SWL) to be operated by manual chain block shall be provided for handling portable ladders for close-up surveys.

4.8    ACCOMMODATION LADDER, PILOT LADDER, ETC.

4.8.01Accommodation Ladder

    

One (1) set of accommodation ladder to be provided on each side as shown on the General Arrangement Plan and to be one man operated type.


The accommodation ladder to be of aluminum alloy construction with fixed curved steps of non-skid type, and to be stowed on the upper deck by the self-stowing system. The ladder to be of one-piece type with a swiveling type upper platform and a lower platform of manual level adjusting type.


The length of accommodation ladder to be sufficient to reach down to about 600 mm above water line when the vessel is in light ballast condition and when the ladder is lowered to the maximum angle of 55 degrees to the horizontal.


The width of the ladder to be about 600 mm and the height of the collapsible handrail to be about 1,000 mm.


The ladder to be designed to support a uniform load equivalent to 75 kg on every step when the ladder is in horizontal position. Individual steps to be designed to withstand a central point load of 75 kg. The platforms to be designed to support a uniform loading in accordance with CB.


The ladder to be stowed in a manner that the steps are positioned vertically within the vessel’s sideline with height as low as possible and to be controlled at the accommodation ladder side.


The manual-lashing device to be provided for sea going condition.


One (1) life net of polypropylene ropes to be provided for common use.


Material        Frame, steps        - Aluminum alloy

            Upper platform        - Galvanized steel

            Lower platform        - Aluminum alloy

            Top rail, stanchion    - Aluminum alloy

            (Folding type)

            Mid rail            - Polypropylene rope with vinyl tube


Accessory    One (1) - Wooden fender of sliding type

            One (1) - Side roller

            Two (2) - Sheave box


4.8.02Accommodation Ladder Davit


One (1) set of davit of fabricated steel construction to be provided on each side of the vessel and to be fitted with the necessary fittings such as chock, eye and sheave.


Galvanized steel wire rope for hanging the ladder to be supplied for each davit.


One (1) set of fixed electric motor driven winch with brake to be provided for operation of each accommodation ladder.


The winch control to be positioned where the operator has a full view of the ladder.


4.8.03Pilot Ladder/slant Ladder


One (1) set of pilot rope ladder operated by sludge davit to be provided on each side of the upper deck in accordance with the requirement of SOLAS and National Authority.


One (1) set of pilot slant ladder to be provided on each side of vessel.


The slant ladder to be of aluminum alloy construction with 600 mm width and to be equipped with one (1) set of electric motor.


The pilot rope ladder to be used in conjunction with the pilot slant ladder.


To get a suitable position and keep safety at the conjunction stage, pilot rope ladder to be moved horizontally on the deck and lashed to sunken eyes on the shell. Location, number of sunken eye and moving range of pilot rope ladder to be determined based on full load, heavy and normal ballast conditions.

4.%2.%3 Wharf Ladder


One (1) wharf ladder of 6m length and 0.6m breadth and one (1) of 3m length and 0.6m breath both made of aluminum with hinge or portable type stanchion, ropes etc to be provided.


4.8.05Monkey stage


The bridge deck will be extended forward about 700mm as the Monkey stage with handrail to be fitted on front wall of wheelhouse. A small hatch to be provided on navigation deck bulwark.


Navigation Bridge wing to be of closed type construction.

4.9STEERING GEAR,Rudder, Rudder Stock and Rudder Carrier

4.9.01STEERING GEAR


One (1) set of electro-hydraulic, two ram, four cylinder type steering gear to be installed in the steering gear room.


The steering gear to consist of four sets of nodular graphic casing (ductile) hydraulic cylinder, two sets of carbon steel ram, a cast steel tiller arm in one piece with a forged steel key, valve box, two sets of hydraulic power unit, integrated hydraulic oil piping, instrument, etc.


The steering gear to be actuated normally in conjunction with all four hydraulic cylinders by either one of two power units, while the other unit to be stand-by (100% standby).Two (2) hydraulic power units can be parallel running.Each power unit to consist of a variable displacement type hydraulic oil pump, electric motor and a hydraulic oil tank with low-level alarm switch.


The electric motor to be started/stopped from the wheelhouse and the steering gear room.


The steering gear to be capable of putting the rudder from 35 deg. on one side to 35 deg. on the other side with the vessel running ahead at service speed at scantling draft. The capacity of each power unit to be suitable for supplying the sufficient power for steering the rudder from 35 deg. on either side to 30 deg. on the other side within 28 seconds when ship in service speed under the above conditions.


The steering gear to be controlled by the steering control system (autopilot) in the wheelhouse and a manual control device to be provided in the steering gear room for emergency operation in case of electric control system failure.


The remote control and monitoring of the steering gear to be provided in the wheelhouse, and the remote monitoring of the steering gear to be provided in the engine control room and any abnormal alarm occur to give the audible and visual alarm also applied in the ECR monitoring display.


The starter panels and auto control panels to be installed on the stiffened and suitable position to avoid vibration damage of the electric parts.


The piping between the pumps and cylinders to be seamless and with wide sweeps at all bends and flanges.


The steering control to be done as follows:

(1) Hand steering control in the wheelhouse

(2) Auto steering control in the wheelhouse.

(3) Non follow-up steering control in the wheelhouse.

(4) Emergency control in steering gear room to be as per maker’s standard.

A telephone to be provided adjacent to the local control device for communication with the wheelhouse.


In case of main power failure, power to be supplied from the emergency generator to one of power units automatically within 45 seconds in accordance with the rule requirement.


In case of single failure in piping and/or power unit itself, the defected circuit to be isolated by manual valve in order to regain the steering capability. The low-level switch to be provided for oil tank to give audible and visual alarm on the bridge and in the machinery space.


One (1) set of storage oil tank with fixed piping for recharging the hydraulic system to be provided in accordance with the requirement of the Rule and Regulation.


The relief valve to be fitted in the hydraulic system in order to avoid an undue rise in pressure above design pressure. Hydraulic oil from the relief valve to be led into the oil tank or the low-pressure line.


The mechanical type rudder angle indicator to be fitted on the steering gear body.


The angular position of the rudder to be indicated as shown on Electric Part.


The rudder angle indicator to be independent of the steering gear control system, and readily visible from the control position.


The rudder stopper to be fitted at the steering gear to prevent the rudder being hard over at 37 deg. on both sides.


Working platform with suitable handrail to be provided around the control device for easy accessibility.


Oil coaming to be provided around the steering gear, hydraulic power units, auto greasing unit and storage tank.

Large tools shall be mounted and well fastened on the wall of the steering gear room, if applicable


Non-slip paint to be applied on the steering gear room floor where necessary for passage and routine operation and maintenance.


The material and construction to be in accordance with the maker’s standard and the requirement of the Classification Society.


4.9.02Rudder


The rudder to be a double plated, streamline, semi-balance spade type as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


Propeller could be removed without dismantling the rudder and propeller shaft.


The rudder to be designed for speed with the vessel running ahead at the specified maximum continuous rated shaft rpm and at at scantling draft in accordance with the Class Rules and to be able to move to 35 degree each side.


The rudder side plating and diaphragm stiffeners to be of fabricated steel plate and built up in conjunction with the upper and lower steel castings for securing the rudder stock and pintle. A round bar to be provided at the trailing edge.


Drain plugs of stainless steel to be provided, one (1) at top and one (1) at bottom.


Welded jumping stopper to be provided under the lower gudgeon with about 2mm clearance for preventing the rudder from undue lifting.


Lifting holes to be provided for the rudder at suitable positions.


Inspection hole to be provided for the lower pintle.


Inspection plug to be provided for pintle in accordance with In Water Survey requirement.


4.9.03Rudder Stock


Rudderstock and pintle to be made of forged steel. A stainless steel sleeve to be fitted on rudder stock and pintle in way of lower bearing and rudder horn respectively with the upper part of the rudderstock connected to the tiller by key through the tapered vertical coupling. The key to be of forged steel.


Rudder stock and pintle to be connected with rudder body by keyless cone coupling using hydraulic pressed fit.


Lower bearing of rudder stock and bearing of pintle to be phenolic resin or equivalentand approved by class.


The bush housing shall be machined after erection, bolted locking ring shall be provided. A lifting eye bolt to be provided for the rudderstock.


Rudder trunk could be arrivedfrom steering gear room through watertight manhole, surrounding rudder stock and shall be welded to the shell plate steering gear flat.


ICCP ground device shall be fitted.


4.9.04Rudder Carrier


A combined cast steel rudder carrier and bearer to be provided.


Weight of the rudder to be carried through the distance piece and split-bearing ring of cast steel on a brass flat bearing disc fixed on the upper part of the carrier.


Upper bearing of rudder stock to be bronze. The bush housing shall be machined after erection. Bolted locking ring shall be provided.


Body of the carrier, bearing disc, bush, etc. to be all in halves.


An electrical motor driven automatic lubricating system to be provided for the lubricating between rudder carrier and ruder stockby grease together with manual device for emergency.

4.10    ANCHORING AND MOORING EQUIPMENT

4.10.01Deck Machinery


Electro-hydraulic, high pressure, non-auto-tension type deck machinery to be provided as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


The strength of the securing of Windlass to meet the requirement of IACS UR S27 and all its revisions that is in force up to the contract signing date.


Reduction gears for the mooring winch and windlasses directly driven by the hydraulic motor to be of enclosed type. The other gears including the large gear wheel for the windlass shall be protected by steel covers.


Each deck machinery to be fitted with hand-operated friction band brake of non-asbestos material and clutch operated locally.


The brake holding force to be in accordance with the requirement of the Classification Society. Safe working load (SWL) of windlass cable lifter including its braking load, mooring winches mooring drum and warping head shall be defined with relevant drawings.


The warping head to be of cast iron of smooth barrel tube type and to be directly connected to the driving shaft without clutching device.


The control handle combined with control valve to be provided near the driving motor of windlass and mooring winch and to be operated at each machine side only.


Seat of deck machinery to be of open type steel construction with height as low as possible.


The resin chock to be used for the foundation/installation of mooring winch, and steel liner type foundation to be used for cable lifter part of windlass.


Coaming with SUS drain plug to be provided.


The material of main parts of windlass/mooring winch to be as follows;


Cable lifter        Cast steel

Mooring drum        Mild steel

Warping head        Cast iron

Shaft            Carbon steel


The construction, other material, etc. to be in accordance with the requirement of the Classification Society and the maker’s standard unless otherwise specified.

4.10.02Windlass


Two (2) sets of separated type windlass combined with the mooring winch to be installed.


Each windlass to have one (1) cable lifter, two (2) mooring drums and one (1) warping head.


Each windlass to be designed to obtain a line pull according to the requirement of the Classification Society at average hoisting speed of 9 meter per minute on the cable lifter at individual operation of the cable lifter. In case two windlasses are operating simultaneouly, the hauling speed of the windlasses to decrease correspondingly.


The cable lifter and mooring drum to be operated independently by the mechanical clutch.

4.10.03Mooring Winch


The mooring winch to be provided as follows：


Location

No.

Rated capacity

(ton x m/min)

Combination

Mooring Drum

Warping Head

Forecastle deck

2*

20 x 15

2

1

1

20 x 15

2

2

Upper deck aft

3

20 x 15

2

1

Upper deck mid

2

20 x 15

2

1


The mooring winch marked “*” on above table to be combined with the windlass.

The rated capacity of each mooring winch to be obtained on the first layer of the drum at operation of single drum.


Either drum of two drums on each winch to be operated independently by the mechanical clutch.


All mooring drums to be of non-split type, constructed with welded steel and shall have capacity to take the mooring rope specified in 4.10.06.


Slack rope speed to be in accordance with the maker’s standard.


All the fixed mooring fittings shall be marked with the S.W.L. by continuous welding.


All wrapping heads should be able to hold minimum 5 turns of mooring rope.

4.10.04Hydraulic Power Unit for Deck Machinery


Two (2) sets of electro-hydraulic power unit to be provided, one in the steering gear room and the other in the forward store space.


The forward power unit to have a capacity for operating one cable lifter or two mooring drums simultaneously at rated capacity, while the aft power unit to have a capacity for operating two mooring drums simultaneously at rated capacity.


Each power unit to consist of hydraulic oil pumps, seawater cooler, electricmotors, starters and other necessary accessory as per maker’s standard.


No interconnection between forward power unit and aft power unit to be provided.


Oil tank, filter, relief valve, thermometer, non return valve, pressure gauge, sight glass, etc. for hydraulic system to be provided according to the maker’s standard and the Builder’s practice.

4.10.05Anchor, Anchor Chain, etc.


The anchor and chain cable to be provided in accordance with the requirement of the Classification Society. Anchor test to be carried out with cable length of max. 82.5m for single anchor as per rule.


(1)    Anchor


Two (2) sets of stockless high holding power type anchor shall be provided with the anchor ring in accordance with the classification requirement.


The anchor shackle to be attached at the anchor ring.


The material of anchor to be of cast steel.



(2)    Anchor Chain


Two (2) set of flash butt welded stud link chain cable of extra high strength steel (Grade 3) to be provided.


The diameter of the anchor chain cable and total length in accordance with the classification requirement.


The chain cable to be connected to the anchor by forerunners with swivel and Kenter type joining shackle.


The chain to be marked with white paint and stainless steel band at stud in last link of every unit length (about 27.5m).


One end of each anchor chain to be fastened and/or released by a cable clench in the chain locker.


Release of the chains shall be made possible from outside of the chain locker in the bosun’s store.


Accessory and spare parts for anchor chain to be supplied as follows and to be stowed in bosun’s store.


2 - Spare Kenter shackle

1 - Spare anchor chain endshackle

4 - Spare taper pin for Kenter shackle

1 - Spare taper pin for anchor shackle

1 - Shackle punch

1 - Pin punch

4 - Chain hook

2 - Anchor hammer

1 - Disengaging tool for Kenter shackle

1 – set of Lead plug (upper and lower parts)


(3)    Hawse Pipe and Chain Pipe


Hawse pipe and frog eye to be provided for the anchor resting.


The clearance between the side shell and the anchor flukes lying inboard shall be approximately 500 mm at even keel of the vessel.


Galvanized steel cover shall be provided for each hawse pipe.


Each chain locker shall be fitted with a chain pipe of welded steel pipe construction with steel round bar welded to the top of the chain pipe and bellmouth with welded round bar reinforcement.


(4)    Chain Compressor


One (1) set of roller type chain compressor to be arranged between each hawse pipe and windlass.


The chain compressor to be of welded steel construction with a cast steel roller and a bar type stopper.


Necessary adjustment between the anchor chains and the stopper bar may be made by welding steel plate or grinding of the stopper.


Necessary turnbuckle and steel wire rope to be provided for fastening the anchor chain.


One set of galvanized steel cover with canvas cover to be provided for each chain pipe.


4.10.06Mooring Rope


The mooring rope to be supplied as follows:


Item

No

Type

Size

Remark

Mooring rope

16

Polypropylene rope

Min. 80 ton x 220m

With eye splice abt. 2.4 m in length

Heaving rope

6

Nylon rope

8mm dia. x 50m

With sand bag


Mooring ropes other than mentioned above to be supplied by the Buyer and to be stowed on the wooden grating in bosun’s store.


Copy of certificate for the hawsers or mooring rope with same diameter and material issued by classification society shall be submitted to the buyer.


No towing rope to be provided.

4.10.07Chafing Bar


The chafing bar to be fitted around the mooring fittings and the transom stern so that the mooring rope on the hull plating can be protected under the mooring condition.

4.10.08Bow Stopper


Not applied.

4.10.09Mooring Fitting


The mooring fittings to be arranged as shown on the General Arrangement Plan and to be in accordance with the requirements of the Class Society.


The mooring arrangement to be as symmetric as possible. However, the mooring arrangement can be slightly changed during the detail design stage in accordance with the Builder’s practice.


The mooring fittings to be designed to apply one (1) mooring rope as per normal mooring practice.


All moving parts to have grease nipple and one (1) sets grease guns to be supplied.


The construction, material, dimension, etc. of the mooring fittings except otherwise specified in this Specification to be in accordance with the Builder’s standard.


All surfaces of the fittings in contact with the mooring rope to be ground smoothly so that the mooring rope can be protected from wearing.


Enclosed type foundations of fabricated steel plate shall be provided for fairleaders and closed chocks.

4.11    LIFE SAVING & LOOSE FIRE FIGHTING EQUIPMENT

The equipment, arrangement, installation and other provisions to be in compliance with the requirements of SOLAS and the National Authority.


The life saving appliance to be equipped for 28 persons.

4.11.01Life Boat and Davit


(1) Life Boat


One (1) set of Free fall type lifeboat of F.R.P. construction to be provided at the aft of the accommodation house as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


The name of vessel and port of registry to be painted at bow.


All outside surface to be of orange colour and inside surface to be of the maker’s standard.


No. of boat     One(1)

Type Fiberglass reinforced plastic free fall type boat.

The boat to be driven by water-cooled diesel engine.

Starting system shall be as per SOLAS.

Dimensionmaker’s standard

Capacity28 persons

Speednot less than 6 knots in smooth water


The lifeboat to be equipped with all loose gears required by the Regulations concerned.

(2) Life Boat Davit and Winch

One (1) set of combined ramp with steel davit with winch and electric motor to be provided for handling of the free fall type lifeboat as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


The davit to be made of fabricated steel plate and complete with winch, block, fall, brake and etc.


The davit to be welded directly to deck. All moving parts to be lubricated by means of standard grease nipple.


The design and construction of boat davit to be in accordance with maker’s standard and to fulfill the requirement of the Regulatory Bodies.


(3) Rescue Boat and Davit


One (1) rescue boat made of fiberglass reinforced plastic for seating six (6) persons to be provided on portside as shown on the General Arrangement Plan.


The rescue boat to be arranged with a single arm davit for deployment and recovery.


The rescue boat to be fitted with a petrolic driven outboard engine to give a minimum speed of 6 knots.


All fittings to be as per requirement of regulation.

4.11.02Life Raft, Buoy, Life Jacket, Etc.


(1) Life Raft


The inflatable life raft to be provided as follows;


Location

No.

Capacity

After part of the vessel (P&S)

4

15 persons

Forward part of the vessel

1

6 persons


One set of launching type inflatable life raftto be provided at port side. One set of dropping type inflatable life raftto be provided at starboardside.


Each life raft to be stowed in fiberglass reinforced plastic container and to be located where easily accessible.


Life raft for 6 persons to be well protected against sea impact damage.


The number of person, which an inflatable life raft to be designed to accommodate, to be marked on the life raft and its container in permanent characters.


The life raft except for 6 persons to be provided with the hydrostatic releasing device. The stowage of life raft to be so secured that overflowing water cannot damage or remove the raft and cannot actuate the release mechanism.


The certificate of inspection of life raft to be valid at least 10 months from the date of Vessel’s delivery.


All necessary loose equipment to be contained with life raft in accordance with the requirement of Regulation concerned.


(2) Life Buoy


The circular life buoys to be provided as follows;


Location

No.

Capacity

Navigation bridge deck (port & starboard)

2

Self-igniting light

Self-activating smoke signal with quick release device

Stern rail, A deck, pilot boarding area (port & starboard)

6

Self igniting light

Vessel’s side (port and starboard)

4

Buoyant life line of about 50 m

Accommodation ladder boarding area(port &starboard)

2

Self igniting light and life line


The life buoy to be made of buoyant material in accordance with the requirement of the Regulation concerned. Each life buoy to be marked with the name and port of register of the vessel in block letter and to be fitted with a grab line.


(3) Life Jacket


Thirty-five (35) life jackets shall be provided in total


Life jackets shall be provided for 28 persons, and shall be stowed in each cabin

Stored as follow:


Each persons28sets

Bosun store2 sets

Wheelhouse2 sets

Engine control room2 sets

Hospital1 set


The life jacket to be stowed in each cabin and the remainder to be stowed in life jacket box.


All life jacket to be equipped with whistle & light and colored in orange.


The name and port of registry of the vessel to be marked on the life jacket.


(4) Immersion Suit


Thirty-five (35) immersion suits shall be provided in total

Stored as follow:


Each persons28 sets

Wheelhouse 2 sets

Engine control room 2 sets

Bosun store 2 sets

Hospital 1 set


The immersion suits to be stowed in each cabin and the remainder to be stowed in life jacket box.


(5) Other Life Saving Appliances


Following to be provided as per the requirement of the Regulatory Body concerned.


2- 4 line throwing appliance

12     – rocket parachute flare


The line throwing appliance, rocket parachute flare and signlas shall have a manufacture date not earlier than 6 months before the scheduled delivery date.


In addition to above, other necessary life saving equipment to be provided in accordance with the requirement of the Regulatory Body and the National Authority.

4.11.03Loose Fire Fighting Equipment


(1) Fireman’s Outfits


Two (2) sets of fireman’s outfit to be provided and stowed in the fire control room (1 set) and the locker in accommodation (1 set) in accordance with the requirement of Rules and Regulations.


The self-contained breathing apparatus to be stowed in the fireman’s outfit box.


Spare bottles as required by Rules for breathing apparatus to be provided.


(2) Portable Fire Extinguishers


The portable fire extinguishers to be provided and stowed as follows:

4.11.04Emergency Escape Breathing Device (EEBD)


EEBD to be provided as per requirement of SOLAS and Flag State. A set of portable air compressor for breathing apparatus suitable for recharging the EEBD to be supplied.


4.11.05 Others


Distress signals shall be provided according to requirements of SOLAS. Other life saving equipment required by SOLAS 1983 and incorporating all amendments thereafter up to the contract signing date.

4.12    VENTILATION SYSTEM

4.12.01General


This section describes the detail of ventilation system mainly for the cargo hold, steering gear room, store and other areas except for the living quarter and machinery space that are described separately in the Accommodation Part and Machinery Part, respectively.


Gooseneck, mushroom or wall louver type ventilators to be provided as ventilation head on the weather deck.


The ventilators to be of fabricated mild steel plate with sufficient cross sectional area and to be weathertight.


The coaming height to be decided in accordance with the requirement of Rule and Regulation concerned.


The size and type of ventilators to be determined according to the Builder’s standard and the requirement of Rule and Regulation concerned.


If the height of coaming exceeded 900 mm, bracket may be fitted on the coaming of ventilator.


The strength of ventilator fitted on exposed deck over the forward 0.25L shall meet the requirement of IACS UR S27 and all its revisions that is in force up to the contract signing date.


4.12.02Ventilation System for Cargo Holds


The cargo holds to be naturally ventilated.


Six (6) wall louver type ventilators with hinged covers are to be installed on hatch cover side plate of each cargo hold as per Maker’s standard.


For No. 6 ballast hold two non-corrosive floating type ventilators to be also installed. Float type ventilators for No.6 ballast hold shall be non-corrosive material and worked both ways pressure and vacuum functions.The size of the ventilator to be decided based on the total ventilator’s opening area per cargo hold volume ratio of approximately 0.80 cm2/m3.


Each ventilator to be fitted with rat proof stainless steel wire net and no ventilation duct shall be fitted in cargo holds.


4.12.03Mechanical Ventilation


The mechanical ventilation system to be designed and installed in accordance with the requirement of the Classification Society and Regulatory Body concerned.


The number of fans and group or independent duct system, etc. to be decided considering the arrangement in each compartment and size of ventilator.


The capacity of ventilating fans to be based on the following air change rate for empty space listed on following table, neglecting deduction made by equipment and other furnishing.


Compartment

Air change rate (time/hr)

Supply Exhaust

Steering gear room combined with aft hydraulic power unit space/emergency fire pump space/rope storage space

5

-

Bosun’s store combined with forward hydraulic power unit space/rope storage space

5

-

Pipe duct in double bottom including lower stool in way of cargo hold

2

-

CO2 room

-

15

Paint & Lamp store

-

10


4.12.04Natural Ventilation


The space other than mechanically ventilated space included in section 4.12.03 shall be naturally ventilated with suitable ventilator.

Emergency generator room

Cargo holds

Stores

Lockers, etc.

Wall louver type ventilators with hinged covers to be fitted on the side of hatch cover for the ventilation of cargo holds.


The location of ventilators to be carefully decided to ensure satisfactory Ventilation.


The space in which the fuel oil samples as required as per Annex VI /Reg.18 of MARPOL are stowed, should be provided with a mechanical ventilation fan.


4.12.05Ventilation Fan


Marine use axial flow type fan of which the impeller and electric motor are incorporated in the fan casing, to be provided.


The impeller of fan to be dynamically balanced.


The fan to be mounted on the coaming with mushroom or louver ventilator, in general.


All external ventilators to be correctly and clearly identified with a nameplate showing the service area.


The interior steel surface of ventilators fan casing to be coated with epoxy paint.


The capacity and static pressure of fan(s) to be sufficient to cover the specified air change rate of respective compartment.

4.13    MISCELLANEOUS

4.13.01 Miscellaneous Marking

The nameplates, mark, caution plate and sign to be provided and fitted as follows:

LOCATION

MARKED BY

On No. 3 hatch cover

Tug mark***

At fore, middle and aft part of hull in way of bulkhead.

USCG bunker transfer procedure

At fuel oil station

Lifeboat/liferaft operation instruction

At lifeboat/liferaft station

Plastic or brass

IMO symbol

As per rules

Notes:

“*”    The marks shall be Arabic numeral of 100 mm projected height.

    The marks shall be fitted up to uppermost operation drafts plus one (1) meter at bow and two (2) meters at midship and stern.

    All draft marks to be measured from the bottom of the keel plate.


“**”    Hold level marks shall be also outlined by welding beads at every 2 m on aft bulkhead of all holds.


“***”    Tug mark shall be provided at the fully loaded water line and heavy ballast waterline.


(1)Room nameplates, valve & pipe nameplates, tank nameplates and other nameplates shall be in English.

(2)In general, the material of the nameplates shall be stainless steel in weather exposed part and plastic in the other part.

(3)Cargo hold number to be marked at accesses from pipe duct to lower stool.


4.13.02Canvas Cover


A canvas cover to be provided for the following equipment and fitting on weather deck.

Cable lifter,

Mooring drum of deck machinery

Winch of lifeboat davit

Winch of accommodation ladder and pilot ladder

Pilot rope ladder

Embarkation rope ladder for life boat & raft

Control hand and winch of hose crane and provision crane

Flood light

Magnetic compass, gyro repeater

Speaker

Projecting lights (for funnel and vessel’s name board)

Hatch cover control handle

Turn buckles of all standing riggings to have canvas boots .

Lifeboat winches and drums

Magnetic compass

Bridge wing gyro compass repeater

50W speaker on bridge wing

Accommodation and pilot ladder winches

4.13.03Store Outfitting





Shelf

Compartment

Tier

Bosun’s store in Forecastle space

Wood with steel frame

In way of side shell

Rope storage space in way of steering gear room

2

Wood with steel frame

In way of side shell

Deck store

2

Wood with steel frame

In way of side wall


Three(3) Steel lockers in deck store,which size is about 1000×600×2000mm and thickness of steel plate is 1mm.


FRP grating to be fitted in way of rope hatch opening for drying of rope. A rope store with expanded metal wall (abt 2.0 m in height) to be provided in steering gear room.

4.13.04Bottom Plugs


One (1) stainless steel bottom plug SUS 316 in mild steel socket welded to shell to be fitted in each bottom tank, clear of dry dock keel block.


No bottom plugs for fuel oil, MGO, lub. Oil tank, etc. to be provided.


Different shape of spanners (square and hexagonal) shall be provided for the clean water tanks andpolluted tanks respectively.

4.13.05Navigation outfit and equipment


(1) Navigation Outfit:


2 -    Binocular, 7 x 50

1 -    Aneroid barometer milli-bar scale

2 -Thermometer for seawater

1 -Thermometer for atmosphere

1-Thermometer (wet and dry bulb-double type)

1-Hydrometer

1 -Hand lead.3.5kg, with 46 meters line

1 -Deep sea lead, 12.7kg, with 230 meters line with reel

1 -Chronometer, portable type (Battery use)

1 -Sextant

1 -Ship’s bell, 300 mm dia.

3 -Black ball, 600 mm dia. folding type

1 -Black diamond shape, 600mm dia. folding type

2 -     Black cylindrical shape, 600mm dia. folding type

1 -Gong, 400 mm dia. with beater

1 -Mechanical foghorn, hand siren type with box

2 -    6-Clinometer, each one clock type in wheelhouse,captain room,chief engineer room, chief officer room,and deck office,each one pendulum type in engine control room and ship’s office..


Two (2) parallel rulers, two (2) sets of divider, six (6) pcs of chart weight and one(1) chart brush to be supplied.


(2) Signal Flag and Book


1 -International signal flag

1 -Ship’s name code flag

1- Pilot flag (GH)

1- Quarantine flag (Q)

1- Blue Peter (P)

2-National flags


Register book and nautical almanac and other navigation books to be supplied by the Buyer.


(3) Voice Tube


No voice tube to be supplied.
