7.1.05Inspection and Test

Electric equipment shall be inspected and tested in accordance with the Rules, the Regulations and the Builder’s usual practice.


(1)    Maker’s Shop Test


Shop test for generators and main switchboard shall be carried out at the maker’s shops under attendance of the Buyer’s representatives and necessary test records shall be submitted to the Buyer.


(2)    On-Board Test


After the completion of installation, the electric equipment shall undergo the inspections and/or the tests in accordance with the Rules and the Regulations.


The inspections and/or test shall be as follows:


a)Generator and switchboard:


i)    The electric loads for generator tests on-board shall be generally the water resistor.


Load test (100% for 1 hour)


ii)    Test for instantaneous fluctuation of voltage and frequency (the motor of largest capacity is thrown in, and full load is suddenly thrown off)


iii)    Parallel running test with combination of the generators used under actual ship’s operation.


The test for shifting the load from one (1) diesel generator to another set shall be carried out and vice versa.


iv)    Protective relay test for generator.


Over-current trip, reverse-power trip, and under-voltage trip for each generator shall be demonstrated.


b)    Motor:


Motors, together with their associated control gear shall be run under normal operating conditions to make sure of their performance.


c)Lighting Equipment:


On-off tests shall be carried out for all lighting equipment, including navigation, signal and searchlights.


d)    Interior Communication and Navigation Equipment


Interior communication and navigation equipment shall be tested to ascertain the specified function.


e)    Radio Equipment:


To obtain the safety radio certificate, tests and inspections of radio equipment shall be given by the testing authority, in accordance with the requirements of International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea (SOLAS).


f)Insulation Resistance:


Insulation resistance shall be measured for the electric systems.


g)    Voltage drop:


Voltage drop shall be measured for several circuits which are subject to the maximum voltage drop in normal service.

7.1.06Application of Electric Equipment

(1) Air Circuit Breaker (ACB)


Air circuit breakers shall be used for protection of the generators.


(2) Moulded Case Circuit Breakers


Moulded case circuit breakersshall be used for protection of feeder circuits and fitted with magnetic instant trip, thermal trip, shunt trip coil and/or under voltage trip coil depending on each application.


(3)     Fuses


Fuses shall be used for protection of feeder circuits, control circuits, alarm circuits and indicating circuits, etc.


(4) Meters


The meters fitted on the motor control gears, main switchboard, etc., shall be of maker’s standard types and sizes.


(5) Lamp and Lamp Holder


a) Incandescent lamp:


Incandescent lamps shall be of vacuum tungsten filament type or gas-filled tungsten filament type.


Bulb glasses shall be clear or frosted inside according to their respective applications.


Lamp holders shall be as follows.


Goliath Edison screw    For lamps above 200 W type (E-40)

Normal Edison screw    For lamps up to 200 W type (E-27)


b) Indicating lamps, Pilot lamps, etc.


Indicating lamps, pilot lamps, etc. and lamp holders fitted on switchboard, motor control gear, etc. shall be of maker’s standard types.


c) Fluorescent lamp:


Fluorescent lamps shall be of hot cathode straight line tube and the start of the lamps shall be done by the glow start lamps or the switches.


The color of fluorescent lamps shall be white.


Lamp holders shall be as follows:


Medium two pin type ...     For lamps above 8W

Miniature two pin type ...     For lamps of 8W and below


d) Mercury arc lamp:


Lamp holders shall be of the same type as incandescent lamps.

7.1.07Color Scheme of Electric Equipment


Standard color scheme of finishing paint on metal surface of electric equipment shall be as mentioned below unless otherwise specified. The inner metal surface shall be finished in maker’s standard color.


(1) Color of electrical Equipment


Equipment

Color in Munsell notation

Generator, motor, transformer, switchboard, starter and control

7.5 BG 7/2 (Blue green) or maker’s standard

Navigation, communication, automation equipment and small electrical equipment

maker’ standard

Outfit for emergency operation

Red


For any ornamental fittings, finished color shall be chosen by the Builder in accordance with the surrounding arrangement.


(2) Color of Indicating Light


The color of indicating lights on the panels shall be as per Builder’s normal practice based on the following principle.


Red

Meaning

Dangerous and abnormal condition


Application

Alarms for dangerous conditions

White

Meaning

Normal working condition, general information


Application

Power source “ON”

Orange

Meaning

Attention


Application

Space heater “ON”

Green

Meaning

Safety


Application

Motor running, turning gear disengage, etc.

Yellow

Meaning

Attention


Application

Standby


Note:

The color indicating lights listed above shall not be applied for navigation lights, signal lights, engine room alarm and monitoring system.


(3) Color of push button


The color of push button shall be as follows:


    Green    :    “Start”

    Red    :    “Stop”

7.1.08Name Plate


(1)    Name plates shall be written in English


(2)    Material of plate


For enclosed space


Rotating machine            Brass plate or maker’s standard

Controller and panel        Plastic plate

Others equipment        Maker’s standard


For exposed space        Stainless steel

(weather part)

7.2    ELECTRIC POWER SUPPLY EQUIPMENT

7.2.01Main Generator


Three (3) sets of synchronous A.C. generator driven by diesel enginesshall be installed in the engine room.


As for the details of prime movers, see Machinery Specification.


(1)    Particulars:


No. of set                Three(3)

Rated output                900kW

Rated voltage                AC.450V

Frequency                60 Hz

No. of phase                3

Power factor                0.8 (lagging)

Rev. per minute                900

Rating                    Full load continuous

Insulation (Rotor & Stator)         Class “F”

Enclosure                IP23 with washable air filter

Cooling                    Self ventilation


(2)    Service condition:


Service condition            No. of set(s) running


Normal sea going            One (1) or Two (2) in parallel

Ballast exchange at sea        Two (2) or Three(3) in parallel

Maneuvering            Two (2) in parallel

Loading/unloading        Three(3) in parallel

Rest in port            One (1)


(3)    Construction, installation and associated apparatuses:


a)    Construction and installation


The diesel generators shall be of rotary field type, semi-enclosed drip-proof and self ventilated construction.


Generators shall be star connected without earthing of neutral point.


b)    Bearing


The bearing of diesel generatorsshall be as per maker’s standard.


c)    Alternator protection


Means shall be provided to prevent the ill effects of flow of currents circulating between the shafts and the bearing in accordance with the maker’s standards.


Resistance bulb (PT 100) shall be fitted for detecting stator winding temperature, two per phase and the temperature shall be displayed in the monitoring and alarm system.


d)    Space heater


Each generator shallbe provided a single phase sheathed wire type space heater to prevent the condensation of moisture when the generator is not in use.


The space heater circuits shall be interlocked with the generator air circuit breakers.


The manual switch for the space heater shall be fitted on the main switchboard.


The lamps indicating that the space heaters are energized shall be fitted on the main switchboard.


Thermostat shall not be provided.


e) Bearing


Temperature sensor for bearing of main generator shall be provided.


(4)    Excitation:


The generators exciting system shall be of self-exciting brushless type with automatic voltage regulators (AVR).


Insulation of exciting generator and current transformers of exciting device shall be in accordance with the maker’s standard.


The main rectifiers, potential current transformers, etc. shall be housed in a steel plate enclosure and installed on the generator.


The automatic voltage regulator shall be fitted on the generator or as per maker’s standard.


The voltage of each generator shall be adjustable manually by the voltage setting rheostat inside the main switchboard.


(5)    Parallel Operation


Generator can steadily run in parallel.


(6)    Control and operation


Refer to Automation Section.


Ballast pumps shall only be run when two (2) alternators are running in parallel.

7.2.02Emergency Generator


One (1) set of emergency generator driven by a radiator cooled diesel engine shall be provided in the emergency generator room.


Space heater shall be provided for the emergency generator and interlocked with the emergency generator ACB.


The emergency generator shall not be arranged to operate in parallel with the main generators.


The generator shall be automatically started by battery in the event of voltage failure of normal A.C. 440V system and shall be automatically switched off upon power restoration signal from the main switchboard and shall be stopped after idly running for some minutes.


Secondary starting facility shall be provided in accordance with maker’s standard.


Particulars:


Rated output            200kW

Rated voltage            AC 450V

Frequency            60 Hz

No. of phase            3

Power factor            0.8 (lagging)

Revolution per minutes        1800

Insulation class            “F”

Enclosure            IP 23

Rating                100% continuous

Excitation            Brushless

7.2.03Transformer


Two (2) sets of 120 KVA A.C. 440/ 230V, three phase, air cooled dry type transformer shall be provided for normal 220V consumers in machinery space and accommodation. (Connection to be delta-delta). They shall be installed in the transformer store next to the engine control room.


One (1) set of 15 KVA A.C. 440/ 230V, three phase, air cooled dry type shall be provided for ship’s forward 220V consumers and installed in fore Bosun’s store.


Two (2) sets of 45 KVA A.C. 440/ 230V, three phase, air cooled dry type (Connection to be delta-delta) shall be provided for emergency use and installed in the emergency generator room.


All transformers shall be of self ventilated, class “B” insulation, drip proof type.

7.2.04Shore Connection Device


A shore connection device shall be provided/incorporated in the main switchboard and shall be rated at 440V, 3 Phase, 60 Hz, 400 Amps.


The shore connection box shall incorporate a 400A triple pole molded case circuit breaker, phase sequence indicator, “power on” indicator lamp, KWH-meter and terminals for connecting the portable shore cables. The portable shore cables shall be supplied by Buyer.


Cable inlet hole (coaming with watertight cover) shall be provided on the wall exposed to weather deck.


Shore power M.C.B. shall be interlocked with the generator A.C.B. in the main switchboard, so that electric power shall not operate in parallel.

7.2.05Storage Battery


(1) General use battery


One (1) set of storage battery shall be installed in the battery room for instrumentation of engine part, low voltage interior communication system, navigation equipment, automation equipment, etc.


Principal Particulars:

Type            Maintenance Free Lead-acid sealed type

Rated voltage         DC. 24V

Capacity    abt.         300 AH (The final decision may be done after

                load balance calculation）

Rating            according to Class requirement


(2) One (1) set of storage battery for the start of emergency generator together with battery charger (Lead acid sealed type) shall be installed in emergency generator room.


Principal Particulars:


Type            Lead-acid sealed type

Rated voltage        DC 24V

Capacity            As per maker’s standard


(3) One (1) set of storage battery for radio equipment shall be installed in the battery room. One (1) set of charger for radio battery shall be located inside the radio space.


Principal Particulars:


Type            Lead-acid sealed type

Rated voltage        DC. 24V

Capacity            As per GMDSS requirement

7.3    DISTRIBUTION AND EQUIPMENT

7.3.01General


The power distribution system shall be of radial configuration, with floated neutral, three (3) wire three (3) phase supply system in general.


Motors for engine room auxiliaries shall be fed from the main switchboard via group starter panels as far as practicable.


Two (2) separate feeder cables shall be provided for the steering gear motors and shall be led on different routes well apart from each other.


Galley equipment and deck fans, etc. shall be fed from distribution boards, which are connected to the main switchboard.


Nautical equipment including radars, gyro compass etc and radio equipment shall be connected to distribution boards with power auto change switch device fed from the main and emergency switchboards.


Lighting system shall be separated into deck part lighting system and engine room lighting system, and lighting fixtures shall be connected to distribution boards fed from main switchboard or the emergency switchboard.


Navigation lights shall be connected to the navigation light indicator panel, which is fed from the main switchboard directly and also from the emergency switchboard.


In circuits supplying power to the essential services, selective tripping means shall be provided between feeder and essential branch circuit and back-up protection means for the non-essential services.


All generators and electric feeder circuits shall be properly protected against an accidental short circuit and/or over current.


Over-current protection of the generators shall be provided on each phase and motor branch circuit on two (2) phases in AC system except steering gear motor circuits, which shall be provided with instantaneous trip means only.


Each feeder circuit shall be protected by a molded case type circuit breaker and battery circuits by molded case type circuit breaker or fuse.

7.3.02Main Switchboard


(1)    General


One (1) set of main switchboard consisting of three (3) generator panels, one(1) synchronizing panel or one (1) synchronizing section which shall be integrated in one of the generator panels, two (2) 440 volts feeder panels, and one (1) 220 volts feeder panel shall be installed in the engine control room.


The generator panels and synchronizing section shall be positioned between the 440V feeder panels so that either of essential motors may be energized from one feeder panel even if the other feeder panel fails.


Generator circuit shall be protected with three-pole air circuit breaker, and feeder circuit shall be protected with three-pole molded case circuit breakers (no-fuse breaker).


Control panels for the Power Management System (PMS) shall be installed in the main switchboard.


In general, insulating material in the main switchboard shall be as per maker’s standard.


The actual composition and arrangement of switchboard shall be according to maker’s standard.


(2)    Construction


The main switchboard shall be of self-supported, steel plated and dead front type.


The main switchboard shall be enclosed with substantial angle steel framework and steel plate, and equipped with the followings:


Hinged doors for access to inside equipment

Louver boards for ventilation

Bottom and/or rear upper part to be remained open for cable leading

Surface of panel to be finished with paint

A metal handrail covered with insulating material to be provided in front and rear of the switchboard.


Floor in front and rear of the main switchboard shall be covered with insulating sheet.


All bolts, screws, etc, used in connection of current carrying conductors shall be adequately locked with locknuts and spring washers.


The entire bus bar system including supports and insulation shall be designed to withstand the short circuit thermal and magnetic stresses to maximum estimated fault level on main bus bars.


Bus bar shall be of hard drawn high conductivity copper.


When the generators are loaded over the preset value for the preset duration, non-essential loads shall be preferentially tripped off.


Consumers on 440V distribution sections shall be symmetrically arranged as far as practicable.


All instruments shall be marked red for nominal value on the dials.


(3)    Circuit Breaker, Protection Device, and Instrument


The following circuit breakers, protection devices, and instruments shall be fitted on the main switchboard.


a) Each generator section shall be equipped with following:


1 – Three (3) phase air circuit breaker (draw out type)

1 - Ammeter with a phase selector switch

1 - Voltmeter with a phase selector switch

1 – Kilo-watt meter(or on synchronizing panel)

1 – Frequency meter

1 - White lamp for generator running

1 - Space heater on-off switch

1 - Orange lamp for space heater ON

1 - Voltage regulator

1 – ACB on/off indicating lamps (green and red)

1 - Reverse power relay

1 - Over current relay for preferential trip (or equivalent)

1 - Running hour meter


b) Synchronizing Section


Synchronizing section shall be individual panel or integrated in the No.2 generator panel and shall be fitted with the following instruments.


1 – Governor control switch

1 - Synchroscope

3 - Synchronizing lamps

1 – Synchronizing select switch

1 – Power management system (separately installed in each generator panel)

1 - Lamp test switch

1 - Stand-by generator selector switch

1 - Green lamp for emergency gen. ACBON

1 - White lamp for DC24V power source

1 – Indicating lamp for emergency generator stand-by condition

1 – Indicating lamp for emergency generator abnormal condition

The abnormal alarm indication shall be provided on engine monitor in the engine control room.


c) 440V Feeder Panel


Required number of MCCBs (plug in type)

1 – earth indication lamp (3 lamps) with selector switch

1 - Insulation level monitor with alarm (on engine monitor)

1 – shore connection device


d) 220V Feeder Panel


Required number of MCBs (plug in type)

1 – voltmeter with phase selector switch

1 – ammeter with phase selector switch

1 – earth indication lamp (3 lamps) with selector switch

1 - Insulation level monitor with alarm (on engine monitor)


e) Air circuit breaker (draw-out type)


Air circuit breaker shall be of motor operated type and controlled by a control switch and additionally a manual operating handle shall be provided.


The air circuit breaker shall have an over current trip device for long time and short time inverse action and also magnetic coils for instantaneous trip and under voltage trip.


Generator shall be protected against reverse power with reverse power relay connected to under voltage trip device.


The air circuit breaker shall be withdrawable type for easy maintenance at the front of the main switchboard.


The air circuit breaker shall have enough making and interrupting capacity against short circuit current.


f) Bus link


The bus link between one generator panel and synchronizing panel shall be provided. The bus link shall be approved by Class Society.


g) Molded Case Circuit Breaker (MCCB)


Molded case circuit breaker shall be equipped with an instantaneous magnetic trip device, inverse time thermal over current trip device.


The breakers shall have enough making and interrupting capacity against short circuit current.


All molded case circuit breakers shall be of plug-in type, so that the breakers may be removed from panel front without de-energizing the main bus.


Molded case circuit breaker for preferential or emergency stop shall have under voltage trip coil or shunt trip coil.


h) Meter


Voltmeter, ammeter, and wattmeter shall be of moving iron type or maker’s standard and frequency meter shall be of pointer indicating type or maker’s standard.


The meters shall be of Class 1.5 and shall have scale of the following range with red color mark at the rated values.


Voltmeter            0 to abt. 120% of rated voltage

Ammeter            0 to abt. 130% of rated current

Wattmeter        15% (reverse power) to abt.130% of

                rated wattage

Frequency meter        55 - 65 Hz


i) Name plate


Name plates indicating service of panels and feeders shall be provided on panels.


In name plates for feeders, name of feeder, frame size, setting value of trip and, in case of molded case circuit breaker, size of cable shall be written.


j) Pilot lamp


Pilot lamp shall be of maker’s standard.


3.%2.%3 Emergency Switchboard


(%5) General


One (1) set of emergency switchboard consisting of one (1) generator panel, 440 volt and 220 volt feeder panels shall be installed in the emergency generator room.


The emergency switchboard shall be of dead front, drip proof and and back front maintenance type.


The actual composition and arrangement of the switchboard shall be according to maker’s standard.


(%5) Construction


The emergency loads listed below normally to be energized from the main generating plant through molded circuit breaker.


(%5) Emergency Generator Section


The generator section shall be provided with following devices:


1 - Three pole air circuit breaker

1 -Molded case circuit breaker for normal-emergency source transferring

1 - Voltmeter with a selector switch

1 - Ammeter with a selector switch

1 - Frequency meter

1 – Kilo-wattmeter

1 - White lamp for generator running

1 - Red lamp for air circuit breaker OFF

1 - Green lamp for air circuit breaker ON

1 - Orange lamp for space heater ON

1 - Space heater on-off switch

1 – Voltage regulator

1 - E/G auto start test push button


(%5) AC 440V Emergency Feeder Section


The feeder panel shall be provided with the following devices:


1 - Insulation resistance meter


Required number of feeder breakers

Steering gear (one set only)

Transformer for emergency use

Emergency fire pump

One (1) reversible E/R fan

One (1) auxiliary air compressor

G/E MGObooster pump (if necessary)

Free-fall lifeboat winch    

Such other emergency consumers as required by Rules, if any


(%5) AC 220V Emergency Feeder Section


The feeder panel shall be provided with the following devices:


1 - Ammeter with a selector switch for reading each phase current of the emergency transformer secondary circuit

1 - Voltmeter with selector switch

1 - Insulation resistance meter


Required number of non fuse breakers.


Distribution boards for emergency lights

Navigation lights panel

Distribution board for AC interior communication

Distribution board for Navigation equipment

Engine control console

Fire alarm control panel

Distribution board for radio equipment

Charging device for emergency diesel generator engine staring battery


4.%2.%3 D.C. 24V Switchboard


One (1) battery switchboard shall be provided for charging and discharging of battery, and distributing DC 24V source to interior communication equipment.


The battery switchboard shall be of dead front and self-supporting type and of such arrangement that the battery may be float charged.


Charging voltage shall be automatically controlled.


Particulars shall be as follows:


No. of set        One(1)

Primary voltage        AC440V, 3ø, 60 Hz


The board shall be fitted with the following instruments and device


1 - Voltage adjuster

1 - DC voltmeter

1 - DC ammeter for discharging current

1 - DC ammeter for charging current

1 - Source pilot lamp

1 - Insulation resistance meter


Necessary number of feeder circuit with fuses.


One (1) portable charger shall be provided for lifeboat and rescue boat batteries charging..

5.%2.%3 Distribution Boards, Connection Boxes and Branch Boxes


(%3) Distribution Boards


Distribution boards fitted in engine room, steering gear room, stores and other similar places shall be of dead front type with hinged door and drip-proof construction.


Distribution boards in accommodation shall be of dead front type with hinged door and non-watertight flush mount type or surface mount type according to their locations.


Distribution boards for 440V power circuit shall be protected by the fixed type molded case circuit breakers with thermal overload and instantaneous trip.


Distribution boards for 220V lighting and communication circuits shall be provided with fixed type miniature circuit breakers.


A circuit label shall be provided on the inside of the door of each distribution board, indicating the service of each branch circuit.


Distribution boards for accommodation use shall be generally installed in cable and duct space.


Cable penetration to the distribution boards in machinery space shall be normally arranged in the bottom part with fixing device.


Protection type of distribution boards shall be meet requirements of rules and maker’s standard.


(%3) Connection Boxes and Branch Boxes


Connection boxes and branch boxes shall be of drip-proof or waterproof construction depending on their locations.

7.3.06Socket Outlet


(%3) Socket outlet shall be of


%2) In cabins, public spaces, inner passages, lockers and similar spaces.


Non-water tight    :     Double type socket outlet.

Body material     :    synthetic resin


%2) In other spaces except (a).


Water tight type    :     Single socket outlet

Body material    :    brass cast


%2) Water tight socket outlet shall be of surface mounting type


%2) Socket outlet on exposed space on upper deck shall be protected with steel box from mechanical damage.


%2) In general, socket outlet except 24V circuit shall be of three pole type, one pole of which shall serve as earthing connection for metal frames of portable appliance.


(%3) Installation

a) In each inner passage and public room, suitable number of double socket outlets for electric cleaner shall be fitted and one (1) for miscellaneous purpose shall be fitted in the wheelhouse.

b) Each one (1) socket outlet of universal type for the electric shaver shall be fitted on mirror light of toilet cabinet.

c) Two (2) double socket outlets shall be fitted in each cabin, for desk lights, etc.

d) Two (2) double socket outlets shall be fitted in each ship officeand gymnasium, for desk lights, etc.

e) Two (2) double socket outlets shall be fitted in each day room for senior and highest officer class.

f) Two (2) double socket outlets shall be fitted in each officer’s and crew’s recreation room, officer’s and crew’s mess room.

g) Two (2) watertight type single socket outlets shall be fitted in galley, pantry, ship’s laundry and office’s laundry.

h) Receptacle shall be provided for each of the refrigerator provided in the various compartments.

i) AC 220V, 10A W/T single socket outlet type:

j) Store and workshop in E/R, two (2) for steering gear room, two (2) for bosun store, air conditioning unit room and emergency D/G room.

k) AC 220V, non-W/T double socket outlet type:

l) Wheelhouse, radio space.


m) Twenty (20) AC 220V 10A single socket outlets of watertight type shall be fitted in suitable positions in the engine room for portable light.

n) For pipe duct main passage, (1) W.T. AC 220V 10A receptacle per every 30 M shall be provided for portable light.

o) One (1) DC 24V, non-watertight socket outlet shall be fitted at the rear of the main switchboard.

p) One (1) set of AC440V 32A, outlet socket for electric arc welder shall be installed in middle deckhouse, bosun’s store and engine room.

q) Four (4) watertight sockets with switch for portable cargo lamps shall be provided for each cargo hold.

r) Three sets water tight socket to be provided on deck at suitable location for Emergency operation of hatch cover by portable electric pump unit.

s) Suitable socket to be provided in each lifeboat davit for connecting the charging device inside the lifeboat.

7.3.07Lighting Switch


(1)    Switches used for lighting branch circuit shall be of synthetic resin framed.

(2)    Switches fitted in cabins, public rooms, inner passages, lockers and similar spaces, shall be of non-watertight type and ones fitted in other places shall be of watertight type.

(3)     In general switches used for lighting branch circuit shall be of double pole type.

(4)    Water-tight switches shall be of surface mounting type.

(5)    Switches for bed lights and desk lights shall be fitted on the lighting fixtures themselves.

(6)    In general switches for ceiling lights in the rooms having separate day/bed section shall be of two-way double pole type and ceiling lights shall be switched on and off at two stations, and one of them shall be fitted near the entrance door and the other near the bed.


For ceiling lights in cabins and rooms, one switch shall be fitted near the entrance door.


(7)    For engine room lights, inside and outside passage lights in accommodation, breakers on distribution boards shall be used as switches.

(8)    Switches fitted on exposed space on the upper deck shall be protected with steel box from mechanical damage where necessary.

(9) Switches for explosion-proof lights shall be of double pole type.

7.3.08Test Panel


One (1) electric test panel supplied from AC 440V normal source shall be installed in the electric workshop with following:


1 – Source pilot lamp

3 – Moulded case circuit breaker and terminal

A.C. 440 V, 3ph, 60HZ, 10A

A.C. 220V, 1ph, 60HZ, 5A

D.C. 24V, 5A

1 – Lamp socket (A.C. 220V, 1ph, 60HZ)

Universal type for incandescent lamp (E-27)

1 – 20W lamp socket for fluorescent lamp (A.C. 220V, 60HZ)

1 – 40W lamp socket for fluorescent lamp (A.C. 220V, 60HZ)

1 – Fuse tester

7.4    ELECTRIC MOTOR AND CONTROL GEAR

7.4.01General

Motors in general shall be rated AC 440V, 3 Ph except small motors, which are rated AC 220V, 3 Ph or 1 Ph.


Motors shall be of design and construction as specified below, however, motors which are a part of maker’s standard package unit for galley, laundry equipment, M/E turning gear and aux. blower, control air dryer, workshop machinery, domestic service or relatively small motors shall be exempted from the following requirements.


Control gears shall be of design and construction as specified below, however, the control panels which have unique design for particular function shall be of maker’s standard including control voltage.

2.%2.%3 Motor

(1) General


In general, all motors, unless otherwise specified shall be of marine use.


(2) Motor construction


In general, motors shall be of squirrel cage rotor, induction type unless specially noted.


a) Totally enclosed type (IP44) for the following motors:


(i) Motors for steering gear, emergency fire pump, hydraulic oil pump for windlass/mooring winches and axial flow fan regardless of the capacity.


(ii) Motors located below low floor in the main engine room regardless of the capacity


b) Totally enclosed, watertight type (IP56) for the motor exposed to weather.


c) Drip proof type (IP22) for the motors other than the above a) and b).


(3) Insulation


Motor windings shall be no less than Class “B” insulation.


(4) Duty


Rating of all motors shall be continuous rating except motors for the following:


Steering gear        :    25% continuous

                    100% one hour

Turning gear        :    One hour

E/R overhead crane        :    Half an hour

Provision crane        :    Maker’s standard

Windlass & mooring winch     :    Maker’s standard

Lifeboat davit        :    Maker’s standard


(5) Bearing


Bearing of motors shall be ball bearing and those of vertical type motor shall be radial ball bearings or angular contact bearings considering thrust load.


Pre-lubricated sealed type bearing shall be used as far as practicable depending upon maker’s standard.


All ball bearings except sealed type shall be greased with grease nipple as far as possible. All bearings for motors shall have international interchange ability.


(6) Space Heater


Motor above 20kW and located under the engine room lower floor，M/E turning gear, steering gear, emergency fire pump, windlass and mooring winch hyd. Pump motors shall be fitted with space heater.


Element heating or winding heating shall be considered subject to marker’s standard.

7.4.03Starter

(1) General


All starters for motors including the group starter panels shall be of marine use, natural ventilating type.


The starters for vital services shall be assembled into a group starter panel as far as practicable and located in the engine control room at the side of the main switchboard.


Starter for each motor shall be built into a drip-proof enclosed steel cubicle with hinged door and any cubicle may be repaired and/or checked safely without de-energizing other adjacent starters.


Starters shall be located near the respective motors as group starter panels or individual starter in a convenient way.


When starters contained in the group starter panels are located far from the corresponding motors, a starter push button and a select type stop switch shall be provided near motor side or on adjacent other starer panel except motors for fans.


Selection switch of stand-by pumps shall be installed on each starter with automatic change over pumps.


Control circuit voltage shall be AC 220V in general, but shall be of maker’s standard, if necessary.


(2) Instrumentation


Starters shall be of magnetically operated type, in general, and shall be equipped with the following devices:


a) Starters for motor above 0.5 kW

1 - Disconnecting switch or M.C.C.B

        1 - Magnetic contactor

        1 - Thermal over current relay (for two phases)

        1 – Start and stop push buttons

        1 – White source indicate lamp

        1 – Green running indicate lamp


b) Motor of 0.5 kW and below to be manually operated by line switch.


In addition to the above, starters for motors of 7.5kW and above, and for vital service, including HFO transfer pump motor, M/E turning gear motor shall be provided with an ammeter.


Pilot lamps on starters shall be of maker’s standard.


Each one (1) set of running hour meter to be provided for essential dual pump motors above 11kW.


(3)    Starting Method


Starting method of motor shall be across-the-line starting type, however star-delta or auto-transformer starting method may be adopted so as not to cause voltage drop on MSB or ESB of more than 15% of rated voltage.


Starters for motors of steering gear and those for vital services shall be provided with low voltage release to permit these motors to restart automatically upon restoration of power, and starters for other motors shall be provided with low voltage protection.


Automatic start and/or stop control gear for standby system shall be provided with automatic/manual selector switch, indicating lamp of stand-by shall be fitted on the starter.

7.4.04Special Control Provisions

(1)    Turning gear


Turning gear shall be controlled remotely by a portable push button box with 15 meter flexible cable. Receptacles for connecting the portable push button box shall be provided onthe third deck and another on the lower floor in the engine room.


(2)    Steering gear


Steering gear motors shall be operable from both the steering gear room and the wheelhouse. Monitoring panel shall be provided in the wheelhouse and the engine control room.


The following are provided for the steering gear (on the steering gear monitoring panel)


1 – Control power failure

2 – Motor running indicating lamps

2 – Motor overload indicating lamps

2 – Motor no voltage indicating lamps

1 – Alarm buzzer

1 – Buzzer stop switch

1 – Phase failure, and other necessary alarm points


Any abnormal alarm according to Rule’s requirement occurred shall be displayed audibly and visually on monitoring panel.


(3)    Emergency stop


(a)    For fire


All Fans, lubricating oil pumps, fuel oil pumps, purifiers, composite boiler forced draft fan, and incineratorshall be stopped by emergency stop push button in case of fire arising in the engine room.


Each one (1) emergency stop push button box shall be fitted at each E/R entrance and , additionally, each one (1) emergency stop push button shall be provided in the wheelhouse and the fire control station.


One (1) emergency stop push button box shall be fitted outside of purifier room near the door.


For ventilating fans in accommodation except small fans, one (1) emergency stop push button box shall be fitted in the wheelhouse.


(b)    Preferential trip


Non-vital motors and consumers shall be automatically tripped, when generator becomes overloaded, by means of shunt tripping or under voltage trip coil of the no fuse breakers on the main switchboard or on group starter panels.


(c)    Emergency stop push button for sludge pump, bilge pump shall be provided on upper deck (P&S) near the shore connections.

7.4.05Electric Arc Welder


One (1) set of transformer type electric arc welder with electric shock preventing device shall be installed in workshop in engine room.


Type:    Drip-proof, portable type, 440V A.C. single three phases, 60 Hz

Rated second current:    300A

Accessories:4 – 25 meters cabtyre cable with connection

1 – Electric holder with 5 meter welding cable and connector

1 – Wire brush

7.4.06Heater


Electric heaters shall be of 220V A.C., 1 phase or 440V AC, 3 phase and shall be provided as follows:


2– sets in wheelhouse (2kw)

1 – set each in following rooms (2kw)

    Drying room

    Steering gear room

    Emergency Generator room


Overheat protection shall be provided for the heaters.

7.5    LIGHTING

7.5.01General


The normal lighting shall be fed from A.C. 220V, 60Hz, 3 Ph or 1 Ph supply system from the main switchboard.


In general, fluorescent light shall be fitted throughout the accommodation and the engine room.


Decorative lighting fixtures shall be provided in the Capt’s class day room.


A system of emergency lighting shall be fitted at stairs, exits, passageways, boat stations, wheelhouse, chart space, radio space, emergency fire pump space, engine room and other spaces as required by Rules and shall be fed from 220V section of the emergency switchboard.


Machinery space light shall be arranged/supplied in such a manner that failure of any one branch circuit shall not cause any space to be entirely dark.

7.5.02Lighting Fixtures


(1)    Type and Material


Type

Material

Location

Water proof type

Bodies:Cast brass orBrass plate or

Stainless steel orSynthetic resin

Exposed to weather,

Refrigerated provision chamber

Non water proof type

Bodies:

Steel plate finished with corrosion resistant paint orSynthetic resin

Living quarter, Wheelhouse, Office, other accommodation space and engine control room

Drip-proof type

Bodies:

Steel plate finished with corrosion resistant paint orSynthetic resin

Machinery space, steering gear room, galley, pantry, store and similar spaces.

Explosion proof type

Battery room and paint room


Lighting fixtures fitted under the risk of mechanical damages shall be protected with polycarbonate or brass guards for incandescent lights and polycarbonate globes for fluorescent lights.


In general, the ceiling lights shall be of fixed type throughout the Vessel, but the ceiling lights in the following spaces shall be of hanging type to prevent damage from vibration.


Engine room (except engine control room)

Steering gear room

Bosun’s store

Engine casing

Funnel inside

Other location if preferable


(2)Machinery and Store space Lighting


Engine room Lighting


Drip-proof 40W hanging type fluorescent ceiling lamps with shield shall be provided for general illumination.


Furthermore, 60W incandescent pendant lamps shall be provided for spot illumination where necessary.


60W incandescent pendant lamp shall be provided for each bilge well in engine room.


60W incandescent pendant type sight glass lamp shall be provided behind sight glass where necessary.

7.5.03Lighting Control


All deck light control switch except lifeboat lighting as per class requirement to be installed on bridge control console.


(1)    Floodlight, funnel light:


Floodlights for deck illumination, shall be controlled from wheelhouse.


(2)    Boat launching light:


The lights shall be controlled near the lifeboats.


(3)    Engine room lights:


The lights installed in the engine room shall be controlled from the distribution boards in the engine room.


(4)    Ceiling lamp:


In general, ceiling lamps in the cabins, the stores, etc. shall be operated by switches located close to the entrance doors.


The ceiling lamps in the rooms having separate day/bed sections shall be operated from the entrance.


(5)    Bed lamp, desk lamp, etc.:


Bed lamps and desk lamps shall be operated by a switch fitted to each lighting fixture.


(6)    Passage lamp:


Inside and outside passage lamps shall be operated by M.C.B. fitted on the lighting distribution boards which are mounted on the walls of the cable duct of the respective or adjacent decks.


Outside passage lamps for emergency use shall be controlled from the wheelhouse.


(7)    Navigation lights and signal lights:


Navigation light and signal lights shall be controlled as follow:


a)    Remote control from the wheelhouse


Navigation lights

N.U.C. (Not-Under-Command) lights

Anchor light

Morse signal light

Steering light

Suez canal signal lights

Suez canal signal light for stern

Huge Vessel signal lights

Deep draft ship signal lights

Ship name board lights

Funnel mark lights

Floodlights for deck


b)    Local control


Daylight signal light

Suez Canal searchlight

7.5.04General Light


Illumination level in general to be in accordance with requirement of Class and following standard if applicable.


The standard illumination level to be average figure measured as specified below:


(1)    Cabin and spaces in accommodation:


At center part between lamp and wall and/or between lamps in cabins and spaces at a height of 1.0m above floor.


(2)    Machinery spaces:


At suitable working and/or passage space between rather larger machines at a height of 1m above floor.

On the desk of chart space

7.5.05Other Lights


(1)Battery room light switch (watertight type) shall be installed outside of battery room.


(2)    Desk light


15W or 8W fluorescent light, non-water tight and stand type shall be provided in each cabin.


(3)    Bed light


8W fluorescent light, non-water tight and bulkhead mounting type shall be provided over the bed head of each cabin.


(4)    Mirror light


15W or 8W fluorescent light, non-water tight and bulkhead mounting type shall be provided above each mirror in each private and public toilet.


(5)    Instrument light

Instrument lights shall be provided for magnetic compass, main engine revolution indicator, rudder angle indicator and other nautical instruments in wheelhouse, and fed through dimmer switches.


(6)    Chart light


Two (2) sets of 40W chart light, each with an adjustable arm and a dimmer switch shall be fitted over the chart table.


(7)    Sight glass light


Necessary numbers of illumination lights for sight glasses and level gauges shall be fitted at suitable positions.


(9)    Signal light for ref. chambers lights

One red light, which shows on and off conditions of ref. chamber’s lights shall be fitted at the door of each ref. chamber.

    

(10)Pipe duct light (fixed type)


60W waterproof incandescent ceiling lights shall be installed in pipe duct, with intervals about 12 meters and closed to the valves assemblies.


(11)Name board light (fixed type)


3- 2x40W fluorescent lights for name board illumination each side

7.5.06Flood Light


(1) High pressure sodium flood light


4 -    400W x 2 for upper deck illumination on navigation bridge fore

2 -    400W x 2 for forecastle deck illumination on foremast

3-    400W for upper deck and forecastle deck illumination

2 -    400W for upper deck after illumination

4 -    400W for engine room illumination

4 -    400W x 2 for upper deck lighting pole


(2) Halogen flood light


2 -    300W for funnel mark illumination


(3) Boat launching light


2-500W incandescent lamp type floodlight with swing arm atside ofboat. for lift raft and rescue boat andshall be fed from the emergency switchboard.

1 - 300W incandescent lamp type floodlight on life boat preparation platform.

1 - 500W incandescent lamp type floodlight with swing arm on upper deck aft and shall be fed from the emergency switchboard.


(4) Portable incandescent floodlight


20 -     300W for cargo hold illumination

36 receptacles with switch, 4 for each cargo hold

7.5.07Search Light


2 -    1000W search light swivel mounting type shall be provided on each navigation bridge wings.

7.5.08Portable Light


10 -    AC 220V, 60W watertight type with 15m cord.


7.5.09Navigation Light And Signal Light


(1) General


In normal, navigation lights, anchor lights and the N.U.C. lights shall be supplied with the normal source of AC 220V from the main switchboard, and in emergency they shall be supplied with emergency source of AC 220V from the emergency switchboard automatically.


Day light signal light shall be be fed from DC 24V storage battery for the ship’s general service from the charge and discharge panel.


Other signal lights shall be supplied with source of AC 220V.


(2) Navigation Light


The following navigation lights of double bulb type and indicator panel shall be provided.


2 -    60W masthead lights (whites), each one on fore mast and radar mast

2 -    60W sidelights (red and green)

1 -    60W stern light (white) at stern

1 -    Navigation light indicator panel of graphic type in wheelhouse.


(3) Signal light


2 - 40W anchor light (white), each one at bow and stern

2 -    60W NUC lights (red), on radar mast


These lights shall be controlled from the navigation light indication panel.


(4) Morse signal light


1 -    Morse signal light on radar mast

3 -    Keys, each one in wheelhouse and on the bridge wings


(5) Daylight signal light (DC 24V)


1 -    60W portable type daylight signal light

3 -    Receptacles of DC 24V, each one at wheelhouse front and on the bridge wings


(6) Steering light


1 - 20W steering light (blue), on aft part of the fore mast shall be controlled from signal light panel and a dimmer switch.


(7) Suez Canal signal light


1 - Set of signal light of X-MAS tree type on the radar mast:


The quantities and arrangement meet the requirement of the sunz canal.


1 -    Switch panel in wheelhouse


(8) Suez canal search light


One (1) 3,000W Suez Canal searchlight shall be supplied by Owner and stored in the Bosun’s store.

One (1) connection box with a switch shall be fitted under jack staff and AC 220V source shall be fed from distribution box in the Bosun’s store. Further, the search light stowing and handling device shall be provided as required.


(9) One (1) huge vessel light shall be provided and controlled from signal light panel.


(10) One (1) deep draft ship signal light shall be provided and controlled from signal light panel.


7.6    INTERIOR COMMUNICATION

7.6.01Automatic Telephone System


One (1) automatic exchange telephone system shall be provided.


The system shall be operated on main/emergency A.C. 220V, 1 Ph source.


(1)    Exchanger


Auto. telephone exchanger of fifty-eight (58) stations capacity, electronic type capable of four (4) simultaneous talking / or calling and with a means for announcement through public address system from the telephone shall be provided and installed.


(2)    Telephone


One (1) each telephone set shall be provided as follows:


(i)    Desk type


Owner’s room

Captain’s bedroom and day room

(Parallel connection with two (2) telephones)

Chief Engineer’s bedroom and day room

(Parallel connection with two (2) telephones)

2nd Engineer’s bed room and day room

(Parallel connection with two (2) telephones)

Chief Officer’s bedroom and day room

(Parallel connection with two (2) telephones)

Radio table

2nd officer’s room

3rd officer’s room

3rd engineer’s room

4th engineer’s room

Electric engineer’s room

Spare officer’s room

Pilot’s room

Crew’s room (16)

Ship’s office


(ii)    Console mounting type


Wheelhouse

Engine control room (2)

Ballast control console


(iii)    Wall Mounting Type


W.T. (Water Tight)


Galley

Pantry

Fire control room

Engine room workshop and electric workshop

Engine room (M/E local control station) with headphone set

Engine room near the ballast pump area with headphone set

Steering gear room with headphone set

Emergency gen. room with headphone set


N.W.T. (Non Water Tight)


Officers’ mess room

Officers’ recreation room

Crew’s mess room

Crew’s recreation room

Hospital

Gymnasium


The telephone in engine room, in workshops and one of two in engine control room shall be connected to a common circuit and they have same calling number.

2 N.W.T. console mounting type

7.6.03Public Address System, Talk Back


(1)    General


A public address system combined with talk back system shall be provided.

Broadcasting or paging for search of person shall be done from phones.


(2)    Main Unit


Main unit shall consist of microphone and monitor speaker, AM/FM radio tuner andCD playeror MP3 and shall be installed in the navigation equipment room.


(3)    Control Panel


The control panel shall be fitted with microphone and monitor speaker and shall be able to control all speakers on board for broadcasting talk back and emergency instruction. The control panel shall be installed in the wheelhouse. The control panel shall be equipped with following speaker exchange switches:


a. Compass deck

b. Outside

c. Machinery space

d. Cabins and corridors

e. Emergency (cabin, corridor and engine room)


The system shall be arranged to operate in following orders of priority :


1st -    Emergency announce

2nd -    General and fire alarm

3rd -    Broadcasting or paging from telephone system

4th -    Broadcasting of entertainment programs


(4)    Speaker


150W loudhailer on the compass deck

Both wings of nav. bridge

Galley

Upper deck aft

C. Bunkering station(P&S)

Nav. bridge wings (2 pcs)

Forecastle deck fore

Upper deck aft

7.6.04Entertainment Device


One (1) set of omni-directional type antenna for TV/FM/AM shall be provided on the wheelhouse top.


One (1) set of AM/FM/TV outlet unit at each cabin, each mess room and each day room shall be installed.


Main amplifier for TV/AM/FM unit shall be installed in NAV.equipment locker.


Entertainment signal shall be automatically turned off when the general emergency alarm system is activated in accordance with Rules requirement.


TV. and Stereo (domestic type) (To be supplied by Buyer)

    

5    20 inch color world wide reception TV

Each one (1) in officer’s and crew’s mess room, owner room, captain’s day room, chief engineer’s day room.


2    Stereo equipment with CD player

Each one (1) in officer’s and crew’s recreation room


2    DVD, each one in officer’s and crew’s recreation rooms

7.7    CALLING ALARM SYSTEM

7.7.01Engine Crew Calling Alarm in Engine Room


One (1) set of three (3) position switch (CALL / OFF / PATROL) shall be provided in the engine control room.


Audible and visual alarm shall be incorporated with machinery alarm and shall be sent to light signal columns in the engine room.

7.7.02Engine Officer Calling Alarm System

Followings shall be provided.


1    Engineer calling system in the engine control room.


6    Engine officer calling shall be incorporated into extension alarm panel of E/R monitoring and alarm system. Each one panel shall be fitted in Chief Engineer’s room, 2nd Engineer’s room, 3rd Engineer’s room, 4th Engineer’s room and Officers’ mess room, office recreation room.

7.7.03Hospital Alarm

Followings shall be provided.


1    Portable push button in hospital

1    Buzzer, in 2nd officer’s room, and alarm shall be sent to the bridge

control console.

7.7.04Ref. Chamber Alarm

Alarm shall be operated on A.C. 220V.


Each one (1)     Illuminated push button in each ref. Chamber.


Each one (1)    Buzzerwith lamp in galley and in the passage near the petty officer cabin (chief steward)


One audible and visual alarm buzzer for ref chamber shall be integrated into the bridge control console.


Alarm shall be operated on A.C. 220V.

7.7.05General Alarm

Alarm to be operated on A.C. 220V emergency supply.


Audible and visual alarm to be incorporated with fire alarm and to be extended to light signal column in engine room.


1    General alarm unit on wheelhouse control console

13    200 mm diameter bell with red lamp to be provided as follows :


1    Inner passage onCaptain deck

2    Inner passage on “C” deck

2    Inner passage on “B” deck

2    Inner passage on “A” deck

2    Inner passage on upper deck

1    Bos’n store

1Wheelhouse

2    Inner passage on Boat deck


5    200mm dia. bells with red lamp, each one in galley, engine control room, emergency generator room, E/R work shop, electric work shop.


Other necessary position as per Rule’s requirement.


The system can be started from wheelhouse and fire control room.

7.7.06Fire Detection and Alarm System


Alarm bells for general alarm to be used for fire alarm through a relay that rings the bells continuously.


The audible fire alarm for the engine room shall be distinguished from all other alarms.


Alarm shall be operated on AC 220V from main and emergency switchboard (or from ESB and built-in battery).


One (1) fire alarm indicator / control panel shall be installed in the wheelhouse and one (1) repeater panel to be installed in fire control station.


Fire alarm system shall be combined with fire detection system.


Alarm push buttonsshall be provided as follows:


1    On wheelhouse console

1    On engine control console

2    At engine room entrance in upper deck

3    At stair case door and exit in Boat deck

3    At stair case door and exit in “A”deck

3     At stair case door and exit in “B” deck

3    At stair case door and exit in “C”deck

3    At stair case door and exit in Caption deck

4    At vicinity of stair way in E/R

2    At upper deck door side

2    Bosun’s store

1     Emergency Generator room

1    Ballast control console


All shall be in accordance with Rule requirements


Alarm signal shall be extended to light signal columns in the engine room.


A fire detection system shall be provided and detectors shall be fitted in the engine room and all stairways, corridors, escape routes within accommodation spaces.


Additional fire detection shall be provided in the following spaces:

%2. Engine workshop and Electric workshop

%2. Purifier Room

%2. Steering gear room

%2. Bosun’s store

%2. Fore paint store


The detectors shall be of smoke or heat type dependent on location of installation.

The fire detecting elements shall be so distributed as to guard all potential fire outbreak points in the engine room and shall be of types that will not cause false alarms signaled by dust, oil vapor or heat normally present in the machinery space.

The fire detector system shall be capable of being tested.

7.7.07CO2 Release Alarm

One (1) CO2 release alarm switch shall be fitted in CO2 release pull box.


Each one (1) set of bell with lamp in workshops, purifier room.


Alarm signal shall be extended to light signal columns in the engine room.

7.7.08Elevator Calling System

One (1) set of elevator calling system shall be provided as follows:


    Switch        Elevator cage

    Buzzer        W/H bridge control console

7.7.09Water Mist Local Fire-fighting Alarm System

The local fire-fighting alarm system shall be combined with the fire detection system.


The control panel shall be provided in the fire control room and the repeater shall be provided in the Wheelhouseand the activated release alarms displayed in the monitoring and alarm system in E.C.R.

7.7.10The Water Ingress alarm in Cargo HoldsFPT & Fore void space

The control panel shall be provided in wheelhouse and the repeater shall be provided in Ballast Control Room.


The power supply shall be operated on AC 220V.


Each audible and visual alarm buzzer shall be integrated into the bridge control console and ballast control console.


The signal shall be interfaced with VDR if required by Rules.

7.8    NAVIGATION EQUIPMENT

7.8.01Magnetic Compass


One (1) transmitting type compass with reflecting mirror shall be installed on the compass deck.


Accessory shall be provided as per maker’s standard


One (1) spare bowl shall be provided.

7.8.02Gyro Compass


(1)    Steering Control System


One (1) set of gyro-compass systemshall be installed in Bridge Control Console and repeaters shall be fitted as follows:


1        Master compass in Bridge Control Console

1        Bearing repeater on front window of wheelhouse

2        Bearing repeater for bridge wings port and starboard

1        Bearing repeater in Bridge Control Console

1        Steering repeater for steering gear room

1        Signal output for each radar

1        Signal output for each GPS

1        Digital gyro repeater in Captain’s day room

1        Rate of turn indicator



Steering unitshall be equipped with audible alarm for excessive deviation from normal course of ship.


Necessary signals shall be fed from the relative nautical equipment.


(2)    Course Recorder


One (1) course recorder shall be installed in the wheelhouse.


(3)    Power Source


The gyro compass shall be operated on AC 220V, 1 PH, supplied from Navigation distribution panel.


(4)    Signal and interface for VDR and AIS shall be provided.

7.8.03Auto Pilot


One (1) adaptive auto-pilot system with dual electric control type of follow-up and non-follow up shall be fitted inBridge Control Console.


The power supply to auto pilot shall be fed from each starting panel of steering gear

7.8.04Clear View Screen


    Refer to section 3.3.05 (2)

7.8.05Window Wiper


    Refer to section 3.3.05 (2).

7.8.06Whistle


Two (2) whistles shall be provided, one (1) air horn on the radar mast and the other electric horn on the foremast.


One (1) whistle control system with a time controller operated on AC 220V, single phase shall be provided in the wheelhouse console.


One (1) push button shall be provided in the wheelhouse and one (1) on each wing of the navigation bridge deck.


The control device shall be used for both whistles.


The whistle light shall be commonly used with the Morse signal light.


The whistles shall be capable of sounding the general emergency alarm signal.

7.8.07Bridge navigation watch alarm system


A system for monitoring the well-being and watch keeping awareness of the watch keeper shall be provided on the bridge and push buttons as follows.


%4     Bridge control console

%2     Chart table

1     Each Bridge wing


The system to give visual/audible alarm in wheelhouse after a preset time and in the event this signal is not acknowledged within a further short preset time, the audible alarm shall be initiated automatically in captain’s, chief officer’s, 2nd officer’s, 3rd officer’s, room and , ship’s office, officers’ public mess room & rec. room.

7.8.08ECDIS


One (1) set of Electronic Chart Display & Information system(ECDIS)shallbe provided at the wheelhouse console as follow:


1- dislay unit(26 inch)

1- processor unit

1- UPS


The ECDIS to be have following main functions:

Electronic chart display;

Radar image superimposition;

Continuous monitoring vessel position;

Route planning and route monitoring


The ECDIS shall have interface with radar, gyrocompass, speed log,echosounder,DGPS,wind speed and direction,AIS,NAVTEX, etc.


7.9    SEARCHING EQUIPMENT

7.9.01Echo Sounder


One (1) echo sounder shall be provided with two (2) transducers fitted at the bottom of the Vessel (FWD and AFT).

    

    Signal and interface for VDR shall be provided.


One (1) recorder with dry recording paper shall be provided in chart space.

Particulars


Depth range        About 400 m

Frequency        200kHz

Output            Maker’s standard

Power Source    AC 220V, 1 PH, 60 Hz (main/emergency)

7.9.02Speed Log


Two sets of speed logs to be provided.


One set of speed log to indicate speed and distance through the water in the forward and athwart ships direction shall be provided as follows:


1    -Main unit in the chart space

1    -Transducer in forward ship bottom

1    -Speed indicator in the overhead instrument panel

1    -Speed log repeater in engine control console


One set of speed log to indicate speed and distance over the ground in the forward and athwart ships direction (linked to rate of turn) shall be provided as follows:


1 –Main unit in the chart space

1–Transducer in forward ship bottom or satellite signal receiving antenna (according to installing space and maker’s supplier)

1 – Speed indicator in the over head instrument panel


Speed signals shall be transmitted to Radars, Auto pilot, ECDIS, Gyro, AIS and VDR.


Both speed logs shall be meet the requirements of MSC 334(90) and SOLAS.

7.9.03Radar

Two (2) sets of rasterscan type, marine radars shall be provided and principal particulars shall be as follows:



3 cm Radar

10 cm Radar

Frequency

X-band

S-band

Output

Maker’s standard

Maker’s standard

320 mm

320 mm

Max. range

64 n.mile

64 n.mile

maker’s standard

maker’s standard

AC 440/ 220V, 60 Hz 1Ph or 3 Ph

AC 440/ 220V, 60 Hz 1Ph or 3 Ph

Display

True motion with ARPA

True motion with ARPA


    Performance monitor and inter switching unit shall be provided.


    Signal and interface for VDR and AIS shall be provided.

7.9.04Anemometer and Anemoscope

One (1) set of anemometer shall be provided.


1    Transmitter on top of radar mast

1        Wind velocity and direction indicator with illumination in wheelhouse


    Signal and interface for VDR shall be provided


    Power supply    A.C. 220V

7.9.05Electric Clock


One (1) electric clock system with 25 slave clocks shall be provided. Electric power shall be fed from the A.C. 220V normally and automatically fed from DC 24V supply system in case of failure of the 220V system.


1        Master clock with slave clock control panel in chart space.

2        3 hand type slave clocks, each one in following places ;


Engine control room

Wheelhouse ( with illumination )

Officer’s recreation room
