7.9.06G.P.S. Navigator

One (1) set of D.G.P.S. (differential global positioning system) shall be provided in chart space.One (1) set of D.G.P.S. (differential global positioning system) shall be provided in Bridge Control Console.

Power source : A.C. 220V, 60 Hz


Output signal of DGPS navigator shall be connected to DSC equipment, radars, AIS and VDR.

7.9.07Weather Facsimile Recorder

One (1) facsimile recorder and built-in receiver shall be provided.


Recording system    Continuous recording on thermo sensitive recording paper

Scanning speed    60, 90 and 120 rpm


Built-in Receiver


Receiving system    Instantaneous tuning unit selection

Frequency range            2 - 25 Mhz 100 Hz step

    Power source            AC 220V, 60 Hz, 1 Ph

7.9.08Loading Computer

One (1) set of loading computer with off-line type shall be provided in ballast control room with the following calculation functions.


Deadweight

Trim / drafts (fore and aft)

Draft correction (fore and aft) due to difference of seawater density

Maximum value of shear force and bending moment at the frame point

Intact stability calculation including GM according to IS2008 code.

Trim/heeling correction

Loading and ballast condition


The hardware including LCD monitor, keyboard and printer shall be of HP PC compatible type.


The loading computer to be capable of handling loading sequence, intact stability and damage stability by defined void space or compartment, ballast exchange sequence, with both numerical and graphic displays, complete with wide screen LCD monitor and HP colour printer, well secured on desk for marine working environment.

7.9.09VDR (Voyage Data Recorder)

One (1) set of voyage data recorder with playback software and connection cable to be provided as follows:


1    -Main control unit in the electric equipment room

7    -Microphone for bridge

1    -Fixed voyage recorder (48h) on the wheelhouse top

1    -Float-free recorder (48h)

1    -UPS for 2 hours in electric equipment room

1    -Remote alarm unit in wheelhouse


The VDR shall continuously record the following data for 48 hours:


- Date and time, ship’s positioning and datum used from DGPS

- Ship’s heading (Gyro)

- Speed (Log)

- Depth (Echo sounder)

- Main alarms (status of all mandatory alarms on the bridge)

- Rudder order and response

- Engine order and response

- Wind direction and speed

- ECDIS

- S- band and X-band Radar data

- VHF Communication (separate channel from bridge audio)

- AIS

- Watertight door, pilot door and fire door Status

- Bridge audio


The VDR shall meet with the requirement of MSC333(90) and SOLAS.


7.9.10AIS (Automatic Identification System)


One (1) set of AIS (Automatic Identification System) shall be provided with main unit and processor installed in the wheelhouse and a combined antennaVHF/GPS installed on compass deck.


Safety distance shall be kept from the magnetic compass.


Main display unit shall be provided near the conning postion.


The system shall meet the Rule’s requirement.


The interface with gyrocompass, speed log, DGPS and radars and other devices as per Rule requirement shall be provided.


Power source: A.C.220V, 60 Hz.

7.9.11 Ship’s Local Area Network (AC 220 V)


The cabling of an independent PC-LAN system to be provided in the following locations:


Wheel house

Ship’s office

Captain office

Chief engineer office

Chief officer office

Second engineer office

Engine control room


The LAN shall not be linked with E/R alarm and monitoring system.


The builder shall be responsible for installing the net cabling and sockets only and Owner will submit all relevant information and supply all the related equipment such as server, computers, printers and etc.

7.10    RADIO EQUIPMENT

    

The radio equipment shall comply with the chapter IV of Amendment 1988 to the 1974 SOLAS convention concerning Radio communications for the GMDSS in sea areas A1, A2 and A3.


Necessary signal and interface with VDR shall be provided.

7.10.01Satellite Communication Equipment


Two(2) sets of standard-C satellite communication shall be provided.


Each consists of the following:

    

1    Telex with VDU, keyboard and printer in the wheelhouse

1    One (1) telex receiver buzzer in ship office

1    Antenna on the radar mast


LRIT shall be integrated into one set of Satellite Standard-C.

Ship security alert system shall be integrated in another Satellite Standard-C.


The ship security alert system shall be initiated and transmits a ship-to-shore security alert in compliance with ISPS code.


The system shall be capable of being activated from wheelhouse and captain day room.


The power supply shall be operated on AC 220V.


One (1) set of FBB satellite communication equipment with high-speed data transfer interface, which is not part of GMDSS shall be provided as follows:

1 – Satellite dome antenna (ADE)

1 – Main unit (BDU)

1 – Power

1 – Data facsimile

2 – Telephone, one in radio space, another in captain day room.


7.10.02MF / HF Radio Equipment


One (1) set of rack type radio console shall be provided in wheelhouse radio space and comprising of:


1-250W MF/HF transmitter/receiver

1-DSC terminal

1-DSC watch receiver

1-Bank of lead-acid type battery and a battery charger

1-Set of accessories


7.10.03VHF Radiotelephone


(1) No.1 VHF


Marine VHF radiotelephone covering 57 international channels and channels for USCG.


Master unit    :        One(1) set


Transceiver and control unit shall be provided on bridge control console in W/H.


Sub control unit    :    One(1) setshall be installed in captain’s day room


2-     Handset connector for both wings

1-     Handset


VHF DSC watch receiver operating on the fixed frequency channel 70 with VHF DSC controller.


(2) No.2 VHF:


One (1) set of VHF radio telephone (same model as No.1 VHF) shall be provided. The master unit shall be provided on the front wall of W/H.

One (1) sub-control unit shall be provided in ship office.

VHF DSC watch receiver operating on the fixed frequency channel 70 with VHF DSC controller.


7.10.04Portable VHF Equipment


Three (3) sets of portable VHF radio telephone with battery charger shall be provided. Three (3) pieces of sealed spare battery shall be provided.


7.10.05Navtex


One (1) set of Navtex receiver shall be provided in chart space.

Antenna shall also be provided.


The system shall be fed from 24V D.C. system.


7.10.06Satellite E.P.I.R.B.


One (1) set of float free type emergency position indicating radio beacon providing transmission on 121.5 and 406 MHz shall be provided.


7.10.07S.A.R.T.


Two (2) sets of search and rescue radar transponders (9 GHz) shall be provided.

7.11    ELECTRIC CABLE AND INSTALLATION

7.11.01General


Cables, in general, throughout the Vessel shall be of marine standard (in accordance with IEC standard only) approved by the Classification Society.


600V cable shall be used for A.C. 440V circuit, and 250V cable for A.C. 220V and D.C. 24V circuit.


All cables except for special services shall be of flame retardant type in compliance with IEC pub.332-3 and category A cable.


7.11.02Cable Application


In general, main parts of cables shall be as follows:


(1) Conductor


Conductors shall be of soft copper wires and shall be stranded except special cables.


Conductors shall be of single (S), double (D), triple (T) or multiple (M) in accordance with the respective application.


Permissive maximum conduction operating temperature of the cables should be of 85oC.


(2) Insulation


In general, ethylene-propylene rubber or XLPE shall be used.


Silicon rubber insulation shall be applied to the cables located where the air temperature is likely to exceed 75oC.


Polyvinyl-chloride insulation shall be applied to the cables for portable and domestic service applications, communication and nautical equipment, and radio appliances according to the maker’s standard.


(3) Inner Covering


Inner covering shall be applied all cables, the material of inner covering shall be according to IEC standard.


(4) Armor


Basket weave galvanized steel or copper wire armor shall be applied to all cables except the cable for lighting circuit in accommodation space.


Shielded cables shall have annealed copper wire braid between the insulation and inner covering.


(5) Outer Sheath


In general, polyolefin outer sheath shall be applied.


(6) General application


Electric cable on exposed deck shall be of with armor and outer sheath covered cable.


Electric cable for lighting circuit in accommodation space shall be of ethylene propylene rubber or XLPE insulated polyolefin sheathed 3-core cable. (One core shall be used for earthing)


Single, double or triple core cable shall be used in general, and multi-core (5 to 33 cores) cable shall be used for communication circuit and control circuit.


Sizing of the cables shall beas per the Classification Rules requirement.


(7) Special cable


Application of special cable shall be as follows :

                

Application

Kind of cable

Microphone circuit, radio equipment circuit, etc. which is seemed to have radio interference by induced current

Twist cable of XLPE insulated, shielded, polyolefin sheathed and copper wire braided cable

Radio high frequency circuit

Coaxial cable

Inner connection of main switchboard

PVC insulated flexible wire and polyethylene insulated flexible wire



Application

Kind of cable

Inner connection of battery switchboard alarm panel, control panel and other measuring instrument panel

PVC insulated wire

Portable appliance

Rubber insulated and polychloroprene sheathed flexible cable

Desk light

PVC insulated flexible wire

7.11.03Cable Installation


(1)    General


a)    Electric cable shall be laid avoiding places of high temperature and high humidity and shall be protected in the place where it is likely to receive mechanical damage.

b)    Cables run in-group shall be supported with steel hangers.The space between hangers shall be not more than 300 mm.


    Hangersshall be fitted with proper space (about 50 mm) from hull structure to permit easy painting of the hull structure.


Main large cable ways such as from generators to main switchboard and similar shall be supported with cable rack.


c)    Cable shall be supported on steel bracket, steel flat bar and fixed with non-metallic cable straps and metallic cable straps.

d)    Cable in ref. provision chambers shall be laid on stainless steel plate seat liner and fixed with stainless steel cable straps.

e)     Where cable penetrates watertight deck or bulkhead, watertight cable gland or approved type compound shall be applied.

f)    Where cable penetrates non-watertight deck, coaming or cable pipe without cable glandsshall be used for protection of the cable.

g)    Where cable penetrates fire-tight deck or bulkhead, cable gland or coaming shall be used for protection of the cable, and filled with fire retarding compound where necessity.

h)    A spare cable shall be provided from main switchboard to the wheelhouse for future use.


(2)    Installation of Cable


a)    Where paneling is applied over the hull structure in accommodation, concealed wiring shall be carried out as far as practicable, and exposed wiring shall be carried out in all other spaces.

b)    Where cable is exposed to the danger of some mechanical damage, it is to be protected with steel plate, galvanized steel pipe (SCH.40), flexible cable conduit or other equivalent means.

c)    Cable on exposed deck between the deckhouse and the upper deck fore shall be protected with galvanized steel pipe, and several expansion boxes shall be fitted.

d)    Cable along the fore mast to be protected with galvanized steel pipe (SCH.40) up to two meters high above the deck or to be installed inside of mast with cable hangers.

e)Earthing shall be carried out in compliance with the Classification Rules requirement.

f)Labels shall be provided for all cable entrance into the main switchboard and all control panels for identification.

g)    Cables that run from emergency generator room to accommodation shall be fully protected with cable pipe

h)    Cable shall notpass over the feed water filter tank. Cable shall not be installed closer than (1) meter to the main transformers.

i)    Water way or stand support, and roller for cable safety shall be provided for cable main box on weather deck.

7.12    SPARE PARTS, TOOLS AND MEASURING EQUIPMENT


Spare parts and tools for all electric equipment, including automation part shall be furnished in accordance with Rule’s requirements and/or maker’s standard


7.12.01Measuring Equipment


1    DC 500V portable megger (100 meg-ohm, transistor type)

1    Potable AC voltmeter/ammeter of clamp-on type

1    Portable circuit tester

2    Voltage detectors (Neon lamp type AC/DC 600V)

1    Portable DC voltmeter (minus 3V-o-plus 3V)


For battery as per maker’s standard.


7.12.02Tool


1    Soldering iron (100W, AC 220V) with two spare heating elements

1    Soldering iron (40W, AC 220V) with two spare heating elements

1    Plier (20 cm)

1    Nipper (15 cm)

1    Adjustable spanner

3    “+” screw drivers, each one of 5, 10 and 15 cm

3    “-” screw drivers, each one of 5, 10 and 15 cm

1    Jack knife

1    Leather band with sack for tool

1    Rubber glove (for 450V)

1    Tool for fixing terminals of batteries


For Battery to be as per maker’s standard.


7.13    AUTOMATION CONTROL GENERAL

7.13.01General Provision

Automatic control, remote operation and central supervision shall be so designed that the propulsion plant shall be operated with unmanned engine room under normal conditions at open water except starting up and finishing of the plant and change of maneuvering modes in accordance with the Classification Society’s requirement.


One (1) sound proof and air-conditioned engine control room shall be arranged in the engine room, where the control and monitoring console of main engine, auxiliary machinery and main switchboard shall be installed.


The main engine shall be remotely operated from the wheelhouse and the engine control room.The machine side control of main engine shall be provided for emergency use.


Automatic combustion control and equipment concerned with composite boiler shall be arranged adjacent to the composite boiler.


Remote control system shall be capable of local manual operation.

Equipment shall be arranged to ensure failsafe on loss of operation medium.

Audio and visual alarm shall be fitted in accordance with the provision of these specifications.


An engine officer calling alarm system shall be fitted to each engine officer’s cabin to act for calling the watch-keeper for watches or in case of emergency.

7.13.02Instrument

All instruments shall be of suitable construction for maximum operating value, and shall have graduations in metric units.


Temperature sensor for remote reading and supervision shall be of the electric analogue type.


Temperature sensor for monitoring of fluid temperature shall be element exchangeable type.

7.14    CONTROL SPACES (FOR AUTOMATION & REMOTE CONTROL)

7.14.01General


In general, consoles shall be of strong and rigid steel construction with hinged or hook-up front and rear doors. (rear door may not be provided in certain contain consoles depending on location and design).


Special arrangement shall be given to the door arrangement in order to avoid vibration.


The foundation of the console shall be rigidly fitted to seating on the deck or platform in accordance with Builder’s practice.


Two sets of working lights with switch shall be installed inside of each console.


No water or oil pipes shall be fitted near to the consoles.

7.14.02Engine Control Room (ECR)


An enclosed engine control room shall be arranged as follows :


The engine control room shall be heat and sound insulated and air conditioned.


Engine control console shall be fitted with centralized supervision, main engine maneuvering devices, auxiliary service instruments, etc.


Main switchboard

Group starter panel for essential motors


The above panels shall be combined or divided into suitable sections depending on development of detail design.


Door with fittings for access to the engine control room from the engine roomshall be referred to Accommodation Part.


Windows for the wall facing the main engineshall be referred to Accommodation Part.


The floor around main switchboard to be fitted with electrically insulated material.


Furniture for the engine control room shall be referred to Accommodation Part.


Package type unit cooler shall be arranged.


7.14.03    Navigation Control Space


Following equipment shall be provided in the wheelhouse.


Bridge control console


Measuring instrument panel


Chart table


Radio table


7.15    SCHEDULE OF AUTOMATION AND REMOTE CONTROL

7.15.01Main Engine Control


(1)     General


The electronic engine control system is provided for remote control, speed control, timing of fuel injection, timing of exhaust valve activation, timing of starting valves,etc. The system has a high level of redundancy.


The main engine shall be remotely operated from the engine control room and the wheelhouse by an electric remote control system.


The manual emergency control of the main engine shall be possible at the main engine side.


Turning interlock shall be provided as protecting and safety devices.


(2)     Operation Mode


a). Remote control from the wheelhouse


Starting, stopping, reversing, speed setting and speed control shall be done and controlled by the control lever mounted on the bridge control console.


The main engine maneuvering shall be remotely affected with program or without program by means of the maneuvering/telegraph lever mounted on the bridge control console.


b). Remote control from engine control room


Starting, stopping, reversing, speed setting, and speed control shall be done and controlled by the maneuvering lever mounted on the engine control console.


WECS/DENIS-9520 mounted on the engine control console. The engineer can carry out engine commands, adjust the engine parameters, select the running modes, and observe the status of the control system.


c). Emergency manual control at engine side


A simple emergency controllever and limit switch for indication of emergency manual control shall be provided on engine side for emergency use.


d). Change-over of control position


Engine side to engine control room


Change –over between engine side and engine control room shall be done at engine side.


Engine control room to wheelhouse


Change-over between engine control room and wheelhouse shall be done at the engine control console by means of the control station transfer lever after confirmation of receiving station.


Control shall be done from one station only at a time.


Each remote control station shall be provided with indicators showing which position is in control.


(3)     Protection and Safety Device


a). Emergency trip


Under the following conditions, main engine shall be automatically stopped with an alarm


Low pressure of main bearing lubricating oil inlet

Over speed

High temperature of thrust pad (ahead)


The exact automatic emergency trip items shall be in accordance with Class rule and maker’s standard.


Reset of shall not be possible, even if the conditions listed above have recovered to normal, unless the maneuvering lever has been placed once at the stop position.


By-pass switchesshall be provided for Low pressure of main bearing lubricating oil inlet and high temperature of thrust pad (ahead) on the wheelhouse console and the engine control room console.


A manual emergency trip switch with cover shall be provided in the engine control room console, at M/E side and the bridge control console for emergency stopping of main engine.


Emergency trip system shall be independent of the remote control system.


b). Critical speed protection


Automatic quick passing program shall be applied over the critical revolution zone during the bridge control.


When the revolution stays longer than the pre-set time, critical speed alarm shall sound.


c). Program speed control


When controlled from the wheelhouse, the engine speed shall be controlled by a run-up program over certain ahead speed by program device with pre-adjusted time up to the set speed of the maneuvering / telegraph lever.


d). Automatic slow-down


During bridge control, main engine speed shall be automatically reduced to slow “RPM” on following conditions.


High scavenge air box temperature per cylinder (fire alarm)

High scavenge air receiver temperature

High oil mist in crankcase

Piston cooling oil outlet temperature high

Jacket C.F.W outlet temperature high

High exhaust gas outlet temperature per cylinder

Piston cooling oil non-flow

Jacket C.F.W.inlet pressure (low)

Main L.O. low pressure

Thrust pad high temperature

Main L.O. high temperature

High exhaust gas inlet temp. of T/C


The exact automatic slow down items shall be in accordance with Class rule and maker’s standard.


By-pass switch of the automatic slow down system except high crankcase oil mist shall be provided on the bridge control console.


These interlocking device shall be manually released after recovery to normal condition.


e). Turning interlock


While the turning gear is engaged, a starting pilot air valve for starting shall be locked.


(4)     Auxiliary Blower Control


Auxiliary blower shall be automatically started/stopped by the scavenging air pressure.


Auxiliary blowers can be remotely operated from WECS/DENIS-9520 onthe engine control console.


(5)     Starting and Reversing


Program for three (3) starting attempt device for main engine shall be provided.


For reversing the main engine the starting air shall be introduced to brake the engine and reverse the engine rotation quickly.

7.15.02Steam Generating Plant


(1)     General


All operations of composite boiler shall be done at the boiler side.


(2)     Combustion Control


The composite boiler shall be equipped with automatic combustion control system to start/ stop automatically fuel and air supply to the furnace to maintain a preset steam pressure. The fuel oil shall be regulated by the automatically operated control valve.


The control equipment of automatic combustion control, forced draft fan and water level gauge shall be fitted at the boiler side.


Remote water level gauge shall be fitted also on the engine control room console.


(3)     Feed Water Control


The feed water flow to the boiler shall be controlled by the automatically operated feed water regulator to maintain the water level within the predetermined limits.



(4)     Safety Device


The boiler shall be automatically shut-down by cutting-off the fuel oil to burner in the following condition in accordance to the requirement of the Classification Society and maker’s standard.


Forced draft fan stop

Boiler drum water level very low

Miss ignition/ Flame failure

Fuel oil inlet temperature too low

Control electric power failure

A manual emergency boiler shut-down means to be provided on the engine control console.

7.15.03Electric Generator Plant


(1)     Main Diesel Generator


a). General


The main generator engines shall have remote starting, stopping device, automatic starting device and their speed shall be remotely controlled from the control room by the corresponding governor control switch on the main switchboard.


A power management system shall be provided


The generator engine can also be controlled at the engine side.


Changeover from H.F.O. to M.G.O. or vice versa shall be manually operated at the engine side.


Lubricating oil temperature control system shall be provided for each diesel engine according to maker’s standard.


Fresh water temperature control for generator engines shall be performed by cooling water system of the generator engines.


Automatic shutdown in the following conditions shall be provided for the generator engines.


Over-speed

Lubricating Oil inlet low pressure

Cooling fresh water outlet high temperature


b). Automatic Operation of Generator


%3. General mode of control


Diesel engine for generator shall be automatically started by compressed air.


%3. Mode of automatic generator control


A stand-by generator shall be automatically started up under thefollowing conditions:


(a)    Black out on main bus bar

(b)    Low voltage on main bus bar

(c)    High voltage on main bus bar

(d)    Low or high frequency on main bus-bar

(e)    ACB abnormal trip on generator in service

(f)    Over current (preference trip) of generator in service.


The stand-by generator will act as follows under above conditions:


Condition (a) :


The stand-by generator will start and connect to the main bus bar


Condition (b), (c) or (d) :


The stand-by generator will start, and connect to the main bus bar after generator ACB in service has been tripped by signal that the stand-by generator is up to the normal speed.


Condition (e) or (f) :


The stand-by generator will start, be synchronized, connect automatically to the main bus bar and run in parallel by automatic proportional load sharing.


The preference trip system to be initiated and trip the non-essential loads with starting signal of stand-by generator.


c). Synchronizing and load sharing modes.


i. Manual synchronizing and manual load sharing:


When “Manual” position is selected for the stand-by generator, the generator can be started remotely from engine control room and connected manually to the main bus bar.


The manual synchronizing shall be available by synchroscope, synchronizing lamps, and relevant control and governor control switches of the prime movers.


The manual load sharing shall be available by means of governor control switches.


The stopping of any generator shall available by the stop push button switch.


ii. Automatic synchronizing and automatic load sharing:


When “Auto” position is selected for the stand-by generator, the generator can be automatically synchronized and connected to the main bus bar, and goes to automatic proportional load sharing.


(2)     Emergency Diesel Generator


Alarm lamps shall be mounted locally on the engine control panel for the indication of the following abnormal conditions.


Cooling water outlet high temperature

Lubricating oil inlet low pressure

Over-speed


The engine shall be tripped on over-speed condition.


The emergency generator shall be automatically started upon detecting power failure of the main switchboard.


Remote control of emergency generator engine shall not be provided.

7.15.04Oil Purifier


Oil purifier shall be operated at machine side.


Oil purifier shall be of automatic sludge discharge type.

7.15.05Main Air Compressor and Auxiliary Air Compressor


Main and auxiliary air compressors shall be automatically started and stopped by detecting the pressure inside the Main air reservoirs.


Main and auxiliary air compressors shall be automatically tripped in the following conditions:


Discharge air high temperature

Lubricating oil inlet low pressure, or Lubricating oil low level

Air outlet high temperature (for main air compressors)


Main and auxiliary air compressors shall be remotely operated in the engine control room.

7.15.06Fresh Water Generator


The fresh water generator shall be operated at machine side.


The fresh water generator shall be equipped with automatic valve at distillate water outlet side for discharging to bilge when high salinity is detected in the distillate water.

7.15.07Incinerator


The incinerator shall be operated at machine side.


The incinerator shall be automatically tripped in case of abnormal condition such as flame failure.

7.15.08Fuel Oil Transfer Pump


The fuel oil transfer pump shall be automatically started and stopped by detecting the level (low & high) of the selected fuel oil settling tank.

7.15.09MGO Transfer Pump


MGO transfer pump shall be automatically stopped by detecting the level (high) of MGO settling tank.

7.15.10Other Auxiliary Machinery


Other machinery shall be operated at machine side unless specified otherwise.

7.15.11Auto Change System for Pumps


The following auxiliaries shall be automatically changed over to the stand-by one, in case of low discharge pressure of the running pump.


However, the initial start shall be performed at the machinery side, in connection with operation of the associated valves.


M/E jacket cooling F.W. pumps

Main cool. S.W. pumps

Main cool. F.W. pumps

Main lubricating oil pumps

M/E F.O. circulating pumps

M/E F.O. supply pumps

G/E F.O. circulating pumps

G/E F.O. supply pumps

Boiler feed water pumps

Stern tube lubricating oil pumps


Stand-by selector switch for auto changeover shall be provided in each starter panel.

7.15.12Fluid System Control


(1)    Cooling Water System


The main engine H.T. and L.T. cooling fresh water temperatures shall be automatically regulated by a thermostaticthree-way valve controlling the fresh water by-pass flow around the cooler.


The diesel generator engine cooling HT FW temperature shall be controlled by a thermostatic three-way valve.


(2)    Lub.Oil System


The main engine lubricating oil temperature shall be automatically regulated by a thermostatic three-way valve controlling the lubricating oil by-pass flow around the cooler.


The diesel generator engine lubricating oil temperature shall be automatically controlled according to the maker’s standard.



(3)    Fuel Oil System


Electro-pneumatic type remote level indication for H.F.O. bunker tanks, H.F.O. settling/service tank, M.G.O. storage tank and M.G.O. service tank shall be provided on the engine control console.



Flow meter with counter shall be locally installed, one (1) for H.F.O. to main engine, one (1) for H.F.O. to auxiliary engines. A by-pass line with valve shall be provided for each of the flow meters.


The temperature in the heavy fuel oil settling and service tanksshall be remotely indicated on the engine control console and regulated by a self-contained direct acting steam control valve on the heating steam inlet line of each of the tanks.


(4)    Fresh Water Hydrophore System


The fresh water pump shall be automatically started and stopped by pressure switch arranged on the fresh water hydrophore tank.


(5)    Stern Tube Bearing Temperature


One (1) temperature sensor with one (1) spare sensor shall be installed on aft stern tube bush bearing.

7.16    INSTRUMENTATION

7.16.01Engine Telegraph

One (1) set of engine order telegraph system shall be provided, and shall consist of:


1 - Transmitter with receiver, bell in the wheelhouse

1 - Receiver with gong at machine side

1 - Receiver/reply transmitter with bell in engine control room console


(1)    The engine telegraph shall have the following divisions.


Ahead    Full

Half

Slow

Dead slow

Stop


Astem    Dead slow

Slow

Half

Full

(2)    The sub-telegraph shall have the following divisions.

Finished with engine

Stand-by

At sea


Three position push button switches for order and pilot lamps are installed in the bridge, and three push button switches with pilot lamp are installed in the control room.


Three (3) push button and pilot lamp shall be included in machine side.

(3)    Engine Order Telegraph Logger    


One (1) set of engine order telegraph logger for recording telegraph positions order/reply time shall be provided inside the bridge control console.


The interface and signal required by the VDR shall be provided.

7.16.02Propeller Shaft Revolution Indicator

One (1) set of propeller shaft revolution indicating system shall be provided and installed at the following places:

One (1)-    Pick-up type transmitter on M/E flywheel.

One (1) -    Flush type indicator with an illumination light on wheelhouse front measuring instrument panel with a separate dimmer switch on bridge control console.

Two (2) -    Wall mounting and water tight type indicator with an illumination light and a dimmer switch on the bulkhead of both wings.

One (1) -    Flush type indicator and counter on the engine control room console.

One (1) -    Flush type indicator on bridge control console with an illumination light and a dimmer switch.

One (1) -    Flush type indicator in chief engineer’s day room.

One (1) -    Wall mounting type indicator at main engine machine side.

One (1) -    Flush type indicator in office mess room.

7.16.03Rudder Angle Indicator

One (1) set rudder angle indicator system shall be provided.

One (1) -    Drip proof transmitter connected to the rudderstock by lever shall be fitted in the steering gear compartment.

One (1) -    Three face type indicator beneath wheelhouse front ceiling center with a separate dimmer on bridge control console.

One (1) -    Flush mounting type indicator shall be installed on the engine control console in engine control room.

Two (2) -    Wall mounting and watertight type indicator shall be installed with an illumination light and a dimmer switch on both bridge wings.


One (1) -    Wall mounting type indicator shall be installed in steering gear room.

One (1)     Flush mounting type with illumination shall be installed on bridge control console in wheelhouse.

7.17    CONTROL STATION

7.17.01Engine Room Control Console

One (1) engine room control console shall be provided inside the Engine Control Room.

The following instruments and equipment shall be installed on the engine room control console.

Two(2) sets of WECS/DENIS-9520 for M/E

Maneuvering lever combined with Telegraphreceiver

Sub-telegraph

M/E safety panel

Alarm buzzer

Telegraph bell

Buzzer Stop bush button

Flicker stop push button

Buzzer test push button

Lamp test push button

Propeller shaft revolution indicator

M/E turbo charger tachometer

M/E control station transfer unit

Fuel oil viscosity indicator for main engine and auxiliary engines

Control position indicator lamps

Auto telephones (2)

Sound power telephone (1)

Pressure gauges

Steering gear monitoring panel

Rudder angle indicator

Two (2) sets of color LCD for engine room alarm & monitoring system

Combined alarm and log printer

Extension alarm main panel with a duty engineer selector function and group alarm lamps

Composite boiler water level indicator and steam pressure indicator

Composite boiler running indicator lamp and emergency stop

Main air compressor running indicating lamp

Clock

Engine crew calling alarm

Speed indicator

7.18    CONTROL AND SUPERVISING PANEL IN NAVIGATION SPACE

Console and panels incorporating electric equipment shall be provided and installed in the wheelhouse as specified below:

7.18.01Bridge Control Console

The following instruments and equipments shall be installed on the bridge control console.

Main engine remote control panel

Maneuvering/telegraph lever

Sub-telegraph

Engine order telegraph logger with printer

Propeller shaft RPM indicator

Control position indicating lamps

Alarm lamps

Alarm buzzer and stop push button

Flicker stop push button

Lamp test push button

Buzzer test push button

Dimmer switches for instrument lights

Whistle controller

Distribution boards for lighting, interior communication and nautical equipment(inside of the console)

General and fire alarm push button

One (1) stop push button for accommodation fan

One (1) stop push button for fans, fuel oil pumps and boiler forced draft fan in E/R

Extension alarm bridge panel

Steering gear alarm panel

Steering gear start/stop push button

Main fire pump start/stop push button

Emergency fire pump start/stop push button

Auto telephone

Sound power telephone

Fire alarm unit

Public address control unit

Navigation light indicator

Group control switches for signal lights

Group control switches for flood lights

VHF radiotelephone

Emergency stop push button for M/E

Radar displays

Main compass and repeater

Autopilot system

No.1 GPS

AIS

7.18.02Measuring Instrument Panel

One (1) measuring instrument panel shall be provided at the upper part on wheelhouse front wall center and the following instruments shall be mounted with their corresponding dimmers switches fitted on the bridge control console.


Propeller shaft revolution indicator

Electric crystal clock

Speed indicator

Inclinometer

Rate of turn indicator

Anemometer

7.18.03Chart Table

One (1) chart table shall be provided in the wheelhouse and the following instruments shall be mounted.

Course recorder

Master clock with slave clock control panel

Echo sounders &recorder

DGPS navigator （No.2）

Speed log display unit

Navtex

7.18.04Radio Table

One (1) radio table shall be provided in the wheelhouse.

World time(built in) to be indicated in GMDSS station.

7.19    MONITORING AND ALARM SYSTEM FOR MACHINERY SPACE

7.19.01Monitoring and alarm System


(1)    General


A micro-processor aided monitoring and alarm system with two (2) sets of displays, two (2) printers, one (1) for alarm and one (1) for logging, shall be provided on the engine control console. One (1) set of display shall be extended to the C/E day room.


The system shall be installed with redundant communication loops.


The function of the system shall be as follows :


%4) Continuously monitoring and displaying analogue parameters (temperature, pressure, etc.)

%4) When any of the input deviates from the pre-set value, an audible and visual alarm shall be issued by the microprocessor unit.

%4) The alarm point shall be displayed and printed on the alarm printer.

%4) The alarm shall be extended to the extension alarm system when engine room is unattended and shall be blocked during attended engine room operation.



(2)    Function


a) Alphanumeric data display on the LCD display unit by operating panel


Data display

Group display

Change display

System status display


Other display function shall be in accordance with the maker’s standard.


b) Alphanumeric auto alarm display


The specified analogue and on/off input channels (refer to schedule of remote indication and alarm) shall be monitored sequentially and if the monitoring point becomes abnormal condition, alarm shall be issued on the LCD display unit with following function.


Item

Condition

Alarm channel on LCD

Buzzer

Press., temp., level and others

Normal

Put -off

Silent


Abnormal

Flicker

Ring


Pushing buzzer stop button

Flicker

Silent


Pushing flicker stop button

Steady

Silent


Return to normal

Put - off

Silent


c) Self check function


The monitoring system itself shall be monitored as per maker’s standard.


d) Print function


e) Alarm extension


All alarms on this system shall be grouped in accordance with Class Rules and shall be extended to the wheelhouse, engineer’s cabin and public room together with calling lamp as follows.


Alarm group :

1. M/E remote control failure & M/E abnormal

2. M/E shut down

3. M/E slow down

4. G/E abnormal

5. Boiler abnormal

6. Other abnormal (alarms required by Rules)

7. Bilge well abnormal in E/R

8. Fire in E/R

9. Dead man alarm


Extension alarm panel shall be provided at following place:


Bridge control console

Chief engineer’s day room

2nd engineer’s day room

3rd engineer’s room

4th engineer’s room

Officer’s recreation room

Officer’s mess room


Additional bell shall be provided at the chief and 2nd engineer’s bed room.


Engineer’s calling shall be incorporated into the extension alarm panel as described in Item 7.7.02.


Also alarm shall be extended to engine room by suitable number of light signal columns combined with color rotary lights and horns for machinery alarm, engine crew calling and general alarm etc.


(3)    Components


The system shall consist of the following components:


a) Data processing unit


Data processing unit shall be provided as per maker’s standard and the Classification Rules requirement.


b) Display unit


Two (2) sets of monitor with control function shall be provided on the engine control console, one primarily for monitoring systems and the other to display alarm status, but both functions shall be interchangeable.


One (1) set of monitor with control function shall be provided in C/E day room.


c) I/O unit


The signal input/output units shall be provided in engine room as necessary.


d) Alarm printer


One (1) set of alphanumeric printer for alarm logging shall be provided on the engine control console.


e) Data logger


One (1) set of alphanumeric printer for data logging shall be provided on the engine control console.


7.20    LIST OF AUTOMATION, ROMOTE CONTROL, INSTRUCTION AND GAUGE


Details about automation and remote control of main and auxiliary machinery, remote watching instruments and alarm shall be determined according to Class requirement.
